description:
Their banh mi's are consistently delicious. I may prefer Dinosaurs, but I really enjoy these too!

My personal favorites are the "regular" pork and then the pork meatball. I love that all options (other than vegetarian) come with pate. 

The bread is just the right texture and the sandwiches also have the ideal ratio of bread to meat to veggies.

Their ginger chicken broth is also delicious and a great side dish or even main dish if you're not feeling great.

Prices are reasonable and service is quick, though the line gets long at prime lunch time.
author: Tay H.

description:
I get phantom cravings for their roast pork banh mi and Vietnamese iced coffee 

I kid u not
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
So good. So cheap. So fast. 

My go-to is the tofu banh mi. It's pretty indulgent with the addition of the mayo/vegan butter, but that's what helps make it 5 stars and it makes me not miss some avocado. The ingredients always taste fresh, it's filling, and it's ready before you know it - even when the line is out the door (for good reason).

Of course, if you're looking for something a little healthier or less carb-y, they've got you covered with bowls, rolls, and salads.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Their banh mi is pretty good for the price you're paying. The size is OK and not ridiculously large, and the peppers are hot! Had the pork belly one and it was tasty. Would go back and try their duck banh mi which was sold out when i went.

I just wish they opened in the weekend or later or any time where I can go because it's basically only open during work hours and I don't work around there but I live very close to it so it's always closed when i walk by as with like everywhere else in fd. #rantover sorry lol.
author: Chung H.

description: Came here for lunch and ordered two items I had the five Spice vermicelli and the pork Bon Me. I would say the flavors were great but the portions are small. I'm glad I ordered two items or else I would not have been full. Ended up paying around $15 for lunch. In summary go to this place if you are looking for tasty Vietnamese food but plan to also get dessert.
author: Ben C.

description:
Solid lunch spot in soma that is open on weekdays only. It serves the lunch crowd. There are a couple of seats but it's mostly a lunch spot.

Their sandwiches are top notch (I used to work near the Hayes valley location) but I would skip the bowls. My favorite sandwich is the bbq pork.
author: Betty C.

description:
Solid place for lunch in FiDi. Lots of options to have banh mi sandwiches, salads, or bowls. 

Really good, tasty bread for banh mi and lots of meat or other forms of protein like tofu and vegetables. 

Be prepared to wait on a weekday around noon with lots of other techies who all flock here, but the line does move and they churn out food really quickly! 

Friendly service despite the hectic busy lunch time. 

A bit pricey for what you get in terms of content, but the portions are fairly large and not pricey for San Francisco, if that makes sense.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Great lunch spot in soma that serves up tasty and filling sandwiches at a reasonable price. The line can be really long, but since there's only a couple items on the menu, you move through it fairly quickly.

The sandwiches are great and not dry like most Banh Mi I've had. I'd recommend getting the roasted chicken or pork sandwich (though I've heard the Duck is really good too). The bread has always been crisp, and all the ingredients used in the sandwich are fresh.

Would recommend if you're in the area for a quick work lunch!
author: Kedar V.

description: Not many "authentic" or close to authentic bahn Mi places south of market in Fidi area. So I this place is worth a shot. I got the meatball bahn meat, it was okay. Their roast pork sandwich is said to be good.
author: Madhu J.

description:
I thought I loved their Roasted Pork Banh Mi until I tried their Duck Banh Mi today. The Duck Banh Mi has officially become my favorite, haha. The meat and flavor in both are so good, but the duck just tastes amazing. 

DragonEats' banh mis are not your traditional dry banh mis; in fact, they're the opposite and are quite moist. I do enjoy how crispy the bread is on the outside, but occasionally my banh mi has been a bit too oily (especially the Roasted Pork Banh Mi because of the pate and how fatty the pork is).

There will be a line out the door starting at 11:30am so come early or later if you want to beat the lunch rush!

Took off one star because a banh mi will set you back $7-$8, which is pretty pricey for a banh mi, but 'tis SoMa.
author: Alice C.

description:
This place was super packed and the line was literally out the door, but it actually didn't take too long at all. Before we knew it, we were at the front of the line ordering and our food was ready in less than ten minutes. They seem to be pretty efficient/organized, getting all the orders right and people in and out the door fast. 

Their menu was simple, which is great especially for me because I take way too long trying to figure out what to eat. Although they only have a few items to choose from, they do them well. 

I had the roasted pork banh mi and it was only about $7. It was delicious and filling. I definitely want to go back to have one of the bowls.
author: Mariela G.

description:
Sandwiches taste pretty good here! I had the chicken which was very flavorful, everything I could want in a Vietnamese sandwich. Be prepared for the jalapeño because it is hot!

Only 4 stars because it is on the more expensive side. In other restaurants throughout the city you can find the same food for about $4-$5 a sandwich. But the location is what makes this place popular. Good for a quick lunch while at work.
author: Manny R.

description:
4.5/5
My parents really liked this place so they brought me here for lunch, and I was not let down. No line on the weekend! I got the pork banh mi and the Vietnamese iced coffee.

The banh mi was a great mix of textures. The bread had the perfect amount of crunch, and still retained that crackling on the outside without being too hard. The pate and the pork made the sandwich quite oily/juicy, which was exactly what I wanted. Some of it was absorbed into the bread but I definitely tried to lick up what got onto my hands, haha. The pickled vegetables were fresh and beautiful. The iced coffee was on the stronger side, and not too sweet. 

The lady at the counter seemed very nice. You can ask for a key for their bathroom, which is down the hall through their back door.

Would definitely return for a quick lunch if I'm in the area again.
author: Marie S.

description:
Another place introduced to me by my teammates and now its my togo place for lunch on regular basis. The only thing I have tried here is the tofu banh-me sandwich. For just 7$ I don't think you can get a better deal in SF downtown. The sandwich bread is pretty crisp and has tofu/vegetables and it's very reasonable in size. 
There is always a long line so it takes around 15-20 min to get the food but it also shows how good they are.
author: Abhishek A.

description: Yes, the food is good, but for me a lunch spot has to be quick. This is one of the longest lines I have seen in SoMa and sometimes it moves pretty quick, but sometimes it can be 30 minutes or more just to order. That's ridiculous, I'm not waiting that long for lunch. I got the Tofu bowl which was pretty good, healthy and what I was looking for. I wish it was easier to order pick up and then come in and get it. I guess I just think they need a space 3x as big :)
author: Jason P.

description:
A great Vietnamese spot for a quick grab and go lunch. Yes there's probably a line but it's fast moving and the food is tasty. 

Ticked away near the on ramp for the Bay Bridge, it's easy to pass by the space and miss it but it's a hidden gem. Grab a bahn mi or get a bun bowl. Great textures in the bowl that you've come to expect from Vietnames cuisine. Roasted pork against bright and fresh pickled veggies, crunch roasted peanuts, all mixed together with some fishy nuoc cham. A pretty good-sized lunch for around $7. A steal in SoMa really. Other lunch options include spring rolls and salads. 

Solid and dependable. Tasty and cheap. DragonEats gets my lunchtime vote.
author: Jon L.

description: Best Vietnamese food I have ever had. Its value for money. Very reasonably priced. Went here with my team the other day. Everyone loved it. I usually take the salad bowl here but banh mi is pretty good too.
author: Prerna M.

description:
Tried the duck banh mi during lunch. I just starting working in this area for the first time and I usually work around Cupertino, San Jose or Menlo Park and live in Fremont so this is what I am comparing it to.

At a hefty price of $8.14 per duck banh mi, I was definitely disappointed. A bit of fatty duck, tons of cilantro and a couple jalapenos with a sweet sauce. The duck wasn't even in every part of the sandwich, probably only covered 3/4 of the bread lengthwise, so there were bites with just meat. There wasn't even an average amount of veggies to make up for it. 

Such a huge disappointment! Especially for the price! Why is this place so popular! I don't understand AT ALL. The food around here must really suck if this place had a line out the door during lunch time. 1/5 would not order again. Maybe I just got a shitty sandwich from a frantic worker in a rush... 

I'd try other places before I come back here again.
author: Leah A.

description: Not a bad place for a quick lunch. The menu is simple, straightforward, and reasonably priced. I ordered the papaya salad with chicken and paid around $7 for it. I got a pretty good portion - just not as much chicken as I would have liked. However, I did appreciate the cooks putting my dressing in a side container without having to ask. The only complaint I have about DragonEats is that there's very little seating space. Also, especially during lunch/rush hour, the hoards of people waiting in line to order can make you feel really hot and claustrophobic. But all in all, I wouldn't mind coming here again.
author: Connie X.

description:
Love their shrimp salad! Good portion and will satisfy your craving for $7.25! Amazing deal for this part of the city. You have the option of cabbage or green papaya for your base. You can also do half and half. :)

Long gets long but moves super fast. See you there for lunch!
author: Heather H.

description:
Super affordable and delicious place to get some food during lunch rush hour. The location is super convenient, hence all the tech workers coming here at noon and the line that goes out the door. It goes by pretty quickly though. 

Personal favorite is the duck banh mi with super flavorful meat and a really good value for the price, especially in San Francisco. 

Would definitely come back time and time again!
author: Lydia S.

description:
Don't let the lines out the door during rush hour deter you! I was here at noon and yes, it looked like all of tech descended upon this small restaurant. But be patient, they are incredibly efficient at keeping the lines moving and pushing orders out. It took maybe 15 min tops from the moment I stood in line to getting my order.

The food is very affordable; at roughly around $7 per order, you won't get a better deal for lunch in this area. They have a selection of sandwiches, bowls and salads with your choice of protein. I ordered the pork bowl which came with a lettuce/vermicelli base topped with pork, cilantro, fried shallots, pickled veggies and a side of a Vietnamese style vinegar/fish sauce dressing. Overall, my order was simple and tasty, though their portions are a tad small. The food is not traditional Vietnamese fare, but for the location and price, I'll be coming back in the future for when I need a quick and easy meal.
author: Christine C.

description: A favorite lunch spot of mine. Their duck banh mi is my go to order. It strikes the perfect balance of sweet and savory for me. It's made slightly differently from the other banh mis. They don't add the pickled slaw and add pickles instead of cucumbers. But it works! The price is super cheap, but the sandwich is just slightly too small for me and I sometimes try to split a second one with a coworker. Be forewarned, the lunch line can easily block the sidewalk traffic. But they're normally very fast.
author: Eric L.

description:
Their banh mis were yummy! I paid $7.60 for a pork banh mi and the only complaint I had was it could have had a little more flavor. I definitely slathered on a ton of siracha. You could pretty much go to other banh mi places in the city for cheaper, which i would recommend. 

What i noticed was that a ton of people were ordering soup, which i would guess is pho? If so, it would be an amazing deal as for $3.25 you get a small to-go container of pho. Now that deal is unheard of in SF.
author: Jessie W.

description: Clean, simple and great tasting banh mi. This is always busy for lunch since they're only open for lunch. Conveniently located within walking distance of a bunch of offices in SOMA.
author: Thomas C.

description:
For ~$7 you get a filling and delicious banh mi in FiDi! I can't believe I've been missing out on this gem until recently. It's a small tucked away place near the highway but it's well worth the trip. They have a couple seats in the restaurant but it seems more like a to go type of place. 

The banh mi is filled with loads of meat and pickled veggies held together by a delicious loaf of bread. The bread holds up well with all the ingredients & sauces and didn't get soggy for the roasted pork banh mi. The bread had a nice crusty outside but a chewy texture inside which made eating it oh so wonderful. They're also willing to remove ingredients that you don't want at no additional cost! 

Wait isn't too bad during lunch hour, but I recommend going earlier to avoid it in general. We came around 11:45AM and we ordered/got our food within 10 mins. 

Don't forget to try their iced coffee too! For $4 it's def on the pricier side of things, but it's sure to wake you up post lunch meal.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Five stars      hands down!!

I stopped by Dragons  Eats with a co-worker around 12:20pm. We were intimidated by the line at first, but someone in line told us it goes by fast!

If the line is long, it might be a little confusing to determine where the entrance is. Just ask if you need to.

Anyways, the line goes by super fast because every order is to go. 

You have a choice of sandwiches, bowls, salads, or a few other items. If you get a salad you get a choice between cabbage or papaya as a base!!!! As a salad  lover I was happy. For protein, you can choose from pork, shrimp, chicken, and tofu.

I got the shrimp salad with papaya. It came with peanuts, pickled veggies, cilantro, and mild fish sauce + vinegar sauce. It was crunchy, and tangy, and filling! And it only cost $7.

I love eating cheap and healthy, and I'm even more happy when the meal tastes great and keeps me full. 

I can't wait to come back!
author: Lawrence K.

description:
I come here every other day(I'm not exaggerating). I'm either there for an iced Vietnamese coffee, banh mi, or papaya salad. They are always super nice, super fast, and I always ask for random requests (extra ice, more veggies, etc) and they take care of me! 

I LOVE YOU GUYS! THANKS FOR BEING THAT THING I LOOK FORWARD TO
author: Gloria Z.

description:
Great quick bite to eat for lunch.

They are quick, clean, and everything on the menu is tasty. The prices are very very fair for San Francisco.
author: Paul S.

description:
I landed up at DragonEats on the recommendation of a colleague for a lunch spot nearby. At the peak lunch hour the place was completely packed with a long line (like every other place in SOMA). The good news is that the line moves fast. The menu is simple Vietnamese Banh Mi, Bowls or Rolls. I decided to get the Roasted Duck Banh Mi ($7) to-go. After ordering it was about a 10 minute wait to get the food.

The short review for the sandwich would be that it was average. The more detailed review is as follows: the duck meat was dry, but they tried to mask that with a lot of au jus, which simply made the sandwich wet, while not doing much for the meat. The French roll was way too crunchy for my liking and lastly a single sandwich would be sufficient only for a light meal.

Price wise it was about where other sandwiches, burgers and hot dogs are in the area. I can get a Banh Mi off a cart outside my office in FiDi for $4.50 so in that sense you are paying for the rent rather than the food. I wouldn't mind stopping by if I was in the area passing through but don't think will make a special trip to DragonEats again.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
This place is a great lunch spot to hit up if you work in FIDI. It usually has a line out the door but they move fast so don't worry! 

They have Bhan My sandwiches, Soups, Bowls, and Rolls. It's so delicious and very reasonably priced. Most items hover around $8. 

Great place for vegetarians and meat lovers alike. Highly recommend!
author: Alex M.

description:
My coworkers and I like coming here whenever we're in need of some strong Vietnamese Coffee and also want to get our Banh Mi fix. DragonEats is one of the more affordable places to eat for lunch around the Soma area. About $6-7 a sandwich. Not too shabby for SF prices!

Every time I visit this place, I'm always greeted by the friendly owner. I love his enthusiasm and find him really entertaining to talk to. He's the one that suggested I try the Pork Sausage Banh Mi and now I'm hooked! I would advise eating the sandwich in one sitting, or else it'll get really soggy if you save the other half for later!

This is definitely one of my favorite lunch spots that I like to visit quite frequently! Come at 11:30 AM or else you'll be waiting in a long line if you come any later. Trust me! :)
author: MyTien P.

description:
I had run past DragonEats several times before finally deciding it was time to go in and try the food.  There was always a huge line at lunch time so I figured it had to be good.  I was absolutely right.

I tried the roasted pork banh mi and the chicken spring roll.  The pork banh mi was absolutely delicious and reasonably priced. They use really crunchy bread and the pork was tender and sweet.  One of the best banh mis I have had.

The chicken spring roll was pretty good. I wasn't a huge fan of the amount of mint that they put in there, but I should have expected it considering it's a spring roll.  The peanut sauce was delicious though.

I will most definitely be coming back.
author: Nick D.

description:
Yum !!!! Amazing 5 spice chicken bowl. I think the best I had in SOMA so far. The bowl came with clear fish sauce on the side which you can add as per taste. 
The place was crowded during the lunch hour just like all other place in SOMA. But the service was pretty quick, they have a small menu as compare to other Vietnamese place and they have a very limited sitting area. 

5 Spice Chicken Bowl - Very flavourful !!! It comes with rice noodles, grilled chicken and fresh vegetables (Soo Good). The chicken was cooked perfectly and all the flavors mix very well with each other. 

Chicken Rolls with Avocado - Star of this dish was the peanut sauce. I never had peanut sauce before and I was thrilled. The rolls were lip smacking good !!! Totally worth the wait :)
author: Simran K.

description:
Great spot for Vietnamese food in the SOMA area. Definitely a good spot to pick up to go because there is not much seating inside. Come early during week day lunch time as the line fills up very quickly. 

The chicken vermicelli is good, but a bit smaller in portion size than I am used to from a Vietnamese place, but the ingredients are fresh. 

The bahn mi's are pretty good as well. I have had the tofu and the garlic chicken. I felt like the garlic chicken was a bit dry. The tofu one was good though!
author: Claire W.

description:
I ordered the Teriyaki Tofu Banh Mi ($6.75). The sandwich was good although it had a lot of sauce! As I took a bite out of the sandwich, a lot of the sauce dripped into my hands. I liked how the tofu was thin and had a sweet teriyaki flavor. It also tasted a little salty. At the other banh mi places that I have been to, the tofu there was very plain. There was a generous amount of vegetables (carrots, cilantro, etc). The bread was crunchy. I was glad that the bread was not too thick. 

The line does wrap outside of the store during lunch time, but it did not take a long time for me to order/get my food. There was not a lot of seating and the place was super packed.
author: Kristina M.

description:
Awesome and surprisingly well-priced lunch spot in SF. It's also one of the few places that has managed to be somewhat "undiscovered" to the tune that it isn't SUPER packed at meal time.

Meatball banh mi is the way to go :)
author: Jimmy S.

description: I was really excited to try this place, seeing all the 5 star reviews. I ordered the duck bun mee, which was really disappointing, there was a little bit of duck, and enough cilantro to keep Chipotle going for a week! Seriously, the first bite into my sandwich was cilantro and bread. The sandwich didn't even contain carrots! Just cilantro, jalapeños, and duck (as an afterthought). If I come back again, I'll try the 5 spice chicken, which people seem to enjoy.
author: Bryan M.

description:
A short walk from our SF office, this place is TASTY! Even if the line looks long, it moves fast as the staff pumps out orders like clockwork.

The 5 Spice chicken sandwich or bowl is damn good. I'm looking forward to trying some other items next time

- Not much parking nearby
- Prices are fair
- Wait is deceptively short since there's usually a line
author: Andrew F.

description:
About $7.00 + tax for a Five-Spices Chicken Bahn Mi sandwich that's the size of my hand.  Its located in the South of Market, so its not surprising about the price.  While the sandwich was average and kind of bland, it was also smaller than the usual Bahn Mi sandwiches I get.

Older guy at the cash register is rude and cold. Very systematic and robotic type of personality. 

Crowds peak at lunch time between 12-2, so the lines are ridiculous.  They could get a second cashier to help with the lunch hour rush.

Parking is hard, but if you're walking over (especially for lunch), watch out for traffic.  The location is a block from a freeway entrance.
author: Chan L.

description:
Eep. Like many local SF Yelpers mentioned, this place is for the budget conscious folks. Even though it's still a bit pricey for a banh mi, it's on the affordable spectrum on where to get food without spending more than $10.

Because I had to try something out of the ordinary, the duck banh mi was calling my name. Not your usual size SoCal banh mi size sandwich, but it packed quite a punch. Would honestly preferred if it was a little less saucy, but that's because I rather not create a mess. Flavoring reminds me of home, which is already a plus in my book.
author: Tom T.

description:
~$8 for a pork noodle bowl here, but really small portion and mediocre flavor. My lunch honestly felt like a snack, because I was so hungry an hour after eating at DragonEats. 

The noodle bowl was mostly vegetables, a sparse amount of noodles, and a few pieces of pork. The flavor was decent, but comparable to any other Vietnamese restaurant (where you could get the same dish for the same price but a much larger portion). 

Disclaimer, this review is just for the rolls and bowls which are the only dishes I've tried here. Many people also order banh mi here, which could possibly have more generous serving sizes and amount of ingredients.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Alright I'm super biased because I had a favourite bahn mi place back where I used to live and this place is not as good. But frankly it probably deserves 5 stars for being one of the rare  places in downtown that is tasty, conveniently located, and also cheap. 

The place itself is pretty small and inconspicuous. Right now it is near all the construction happening on Folsom but don't be deterred! For ~$7 you can get a delicious sandwich that is way better than Subway or Chipotle. 

The sub itself is not super large, probably around 15 cm (fine 6 inches). You get standard bahn mi fillings: pickled carrots, pickled onions, cilantro, peppers. I have always gotten sate tofu and it is pretty good. A little too sweet for my personal taste. The baguette is nice and crispy though and they pack it in pretty good. 

Not much seating inside so it's more of a grab and go situation. Definitely worth trying out if you are in the neighbourhood!
author: Jenny L.

description: Great spot for lunch in FiDi! It's SF-priced banh mi, but it's still a "cheap" lunch for SOMA. I had the duck banh mi and the flavors were good! I didn't realize it didn't come with pickled carrots and daikon like most banh mi, but instead I believe there were pickled cucumbers. Like a lot of reviewers said, some of the banh mi are pretty messy to eat because of the amount of juice/sauce. My sandwich was also overflowing with cilantro, and I had plenty of extra that had fallen out that I just threw away.
author: Allison Y.

description:
DragonEats is a bit of a hike for me and because of it, I've only been once.  But that one time was pretty good and I do think about going back when I have a long time (read = Sup and Director are gone for the day).

The place is across the street from the Mexican consulate, so if you know where that is, you're in good shape.  It's really on the fringe of FiDi, in my opinion.  However I'd say it's worth the trip.  The place is really small with a few chairs outside and very very little space for dining in, so be forewarned.  While the line was long, the workers are extremely efficient (order taking and making the sandwiches).  

As for the sandwich, they had something really awesome:  duck!  Yup, the quacker.  And it was so damn good.  More to the point, they even put a nice, sweet sauce on it that was amazing.  Along with the pickled veggies and the baguette that is oh so damn right, I really enjoyed the experience.  I do plan to go back for sure and I really recommend this small shop if you're looking for really good food at a reasonably affordable price.
author: Bob K.

description: First time to be here and the roast duck sandwich did surprise me a lot - the meat is very juicy and flavorful. The only thing is that there's some greens that I don't eat, which I will remove them from my order ahead next time. Definitely would come back to try another one :)
author: Yuen Yung L.

description: Tried the duck banh mi and thought it was pretty good.  The bread was nice and crispy, the duck had a sweet/tangy sauce, and the sandwich was filled with just right amount of cilantro, jalapeño, and cucumber.  Compared to other mom and pop banh mi shops (~$4-$5), the sandwich was a little pricier (~$7+) but I don't see duck sandwiches often so I had to try it!  I came after 1pm, and the line wasn't bad. It's a good place to get lunch for under $10 though portions do run small. But because the food tasted fresh and good, it's worth it.
author: Marian Y.

description: I LOVE DUCK, AND THEY HAVE A DUCK BANH MI. The sauce that goes into it was a m a z I n g . This was definitely one of the best banh mi's I've ever had!!
author: Sharon W.

description: Garlic butter chicken is the best!!! See my older review for more info on some of the other ones but this one is by far my favorite
author: Laura D.

description: Squeee! ^_^ this is my new favourite place to get banh mi in SF! There was a long line when I went with my coworkers one weekday for lunch. I tried to order the duck but unfortunately it was no longer available. Going off a recommendation, I had the 5-spice chicken instead, and ooh boy was not disappointed. It was just the right taste and texture to satisfy that banh mi craving. There's definitely a reason this place is so popular and I can't wait to come back and try something else!
author: Bianca C.

description:
Clean and quite. Foods are not expensive but little bit small. If you are normal person, you should order two foods to get enough. 

Quality of food is not too good and not too bad. Just basic Vietnamese food. 

It is good place for lunch and to go.
author: Da Won L.

description: Had high hopes given the mom and pop nature of this spot. I like you can see all the fresh veggies being prepped. I got a shrimp spring roll. Lettuce, noodle, and shrimp, that's it. Cilantro on the top, not even in the roll. Bland, basic, and it didn't even stay wrapped. Opened faced roll I guess. Also, service is terrible, the cashier is rude, and the food was meh. I won't be back.
author: Brenna S.

description: Good lunch spot for pork banh mi. Consistently and reliably delicious, albeit pricey.
author: Josh L.

description:
Duuuuuuuude. Yes yes yes.
We went here 5 ppl -- all of us ordered a different sandwich (and one soup), all of us super pleased. Could be that the secret is their really tasty bread.

Not only that, it's cheap, they worked through a long line in no time, and despite being a kinda small place it's got huge windows and is quite a nice place to be. Looks really hipster-y with the exposed concrete and heavy wooden furniture and whatnot. I like it.

Quick, affordable and tasty, just like we like out takeout.
author: Mattis E.

description:
I'm a sucker for a good banh mi. DragonEats has a good banh mi.

The bread is right. The pickled veggies are right. The price is almost right. Ordering the five-spice chicken seems wrong because pork is the finest of all the meats (and the one that belongs in a banh mi), but I'm trying to "be healthy" and "not die of a heart attack." 

And it tasted oh so right anyway.
author: Peter D.

description:
So happy to be close to one of my favorite lunch spots again! I could eat the chicken avocado rolls everyday. A unique take on spring rolls and the peanut sauce is on point. So good! 

Always quick, even during peak lunch hours, and consistently fresh and tasty!
author: Rochelle N.

description:
DRAGON EATS IS MY FAVORITE LUNCH IN FIDI! I always get two orders (and it comes out to $14) with plenty to take home for a mid day snack. 

My goto's:
- Shrimp Roll $7: SO FRESH, the wrap that is used is amazing. It's 2 full rolls cut into three pieces each for a total of 6 pieces. 
- Pork Bahn Mi $7: the pork meat is so fatty. The bread is a traditional Vietnamese baguette, that is very fluffy inside and crunchy outside. Be prepared!!! IF you don't eat this fast enough the bread will get soggy; :P

Long long outside; at least 15 minute wait if you come after 12pm. Very limited seating outside, but there's lots of local park areas you can eat at. 

Other delicious things include their bowls (Love 5 spice chicken) and their butter chicken banh mi. Though it is a bit expensive-- $14 for lunch (WOAH) it's definitely enough to save for a snack later. Come here to mix up your midday lunch!
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Awesome Vietnamese place to pick up quality Banh mi. 
Fabulous service, very quick take out place
author: Satish T.

description: Long lunch line, crowded, must be good huh? Not so. I got the roast pork fresh bowl. They probably filled 2/3rds of a small soup container, if that. I suppose if you're paying under $8, that's just how much you get. Most of it is lettuce and vegetables, definitely not alot of rice noodle at all. I don't even remember eating rice noodles. The pork portion was surprisingly large, but the quality is extremely low. A lot of it is fat, and it's not the juicy, smoky, lemongrass pork you'd find at almost any other Vietnamese joints. I found the pork quite dry. Their sauce also left much to be desired. It's kind of bland rather than sweet and tangy. Overall, the most disappointing Vietnamese rice bowl you'll find in the city. Luckily didn't pay that much for it. I'd still be open to trying their rolls and banh mi.
author: Ke C.

description:
SF lunch-focused eateries continue to blow me away. I'm here all the time in the city, and you can count on a few things including unpredictable weather and a mad lunch rush to every restaurant around. Not quite as dependable (but almost) is their ability to handle a rush, but happily that's not the case at DragonEats.

We mobbed the place just before noon and packed the line out the door. Ever drop a sugar-filled candy on the forest floor? Within seconds they swarm and overtake it. Like locusts in our own proverbial plague of hungry people, I was afraid we'd never get out of there with our food in the short time allotted for lunch.

I'm happy to report that indeed, this SF lunch-focused eatery did not let me down. It was almost as though I didn't stop moving in the line, and submitted my order within a few minutes, then only waited a few for my food to be ready. The place cleared out in 15 minutes as seating is limited and many took their meals to go, but I ended up staying and sitting at the front window "bar" seating.

I shared a few sandwiches. Their menu lists them as banh my, but I've always seen it banh mi, and I'm just not food savvy enough to know if that's a creative choice, a real thing, or even a typo. So let's just call it a Vietnamese sandwich. I sampled three: roasted pork, le sardine, and the duck. For me, the winner was the duck followed by the sardine. I loved the roasted pork but I wanted a little more punch in the flavor as it came off a little sweet. But I'd gladly eat any of them again.

The real kicker here is the price. I know banh mi are typically very affordable, but for this city you seem to end up paying more. Even so, the most expensive sandwich was $7, and seven bucks for ANY lunch is a smokin' deal. 

Beyond banh mi, they do a vermicelli bowl or soup, but when you have such an interesting variety of sandwiches in front of you, you dive into them and go for it. 

This spot was definitely a Yelp app victory. Such tasty food served up in lightning speed (witchcraft?) at really affordable prices makes it a city lunch spot trifecta champion.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: This place has really juicy Banh Mi sandwiches, I've tried all the flavors/ fillings and my favorite is the veggie. Yeah the lines are usually there during lunch hours because its by the FiDi so everyone heads here for lunch, but it goes by quickly. The rolls are good but from my experience I still prefer Fresh Rolls.
author: Gina B.

description:
We went as a large group for lunch. The line was out the door! They are quick and efficient! Order and pay at the counter then wait off to the side. Before you know it, they are calling your number! 

I got the 5 spice chicken bowl and the soup of the day! The chicken dish was delicious! It had great flavor and a generous amount of chicken. The soup was very gingery... Yet satisfying at the same time! The ingredients are so fresh that you can smell the freshness as you walk in! 

They also added free cucumber water as you waited. It was crisp and refreshing and an added treat!

Wish we had one closer to Rhode Island!
author: Michael P.

description:
Come early to try the duck sandwich, which is typically out by 12:30. Ties for first with the roasted duck is the garlic chicken sandwich, I can never choose between the two. 

The main difference is the sauce: duck has sweet and sour chili sauce while the garlic chicken is sauces with garlic and butter. Both very different from the traditional banh mi sandwiches that have pate.
author: Marfel L.

description: The food was fine.  They are exceptionally unwelcoming to the disabled. *Exceptionally*.
author: scout s.

description:
Great lunch place. A bit overpriced for banh mi, but what more do you expect in SOMA?

As a vegetarian, I appreciate how the vegetarian option is not just vegetables stuffed into a bun. The bread used is a very traditional Vietnamese baguette: fluffy on the inside and slightly crusty to give a light crunch on the outside. I absolutely love how they pack the sandwich with tons of pickled vegetables because I'm always one to ask for extra picked vegetables in my banh mi!

It gets pretty packed during lunch time. There's usually a line that goes out of the door, while it is crowded with people standing to pick up their order on the inside. If you want to avoid the wait, go slightly before or after 12:00-1:00PM.
author: Lisa T.

description: I've been here twice: first time I had vermicelli salad and second time had the classic duck sandwich. I think the duck itself is tasty but the sauce is too strong. It's way too sweet for lunch or dinner, seems to me like a dessert kind... I don't think it's worth the waiting...
author: Isabelle L.

description:
I don't prefer Asian-fusion food as each cuisine style is good on its own, so there's no need to merge flavors. This place is an exception. Everything I've tried has been good, from the roast pork bowl to the ginger soup w/kale to the garlic butter chicken breast sandwich. Will return to try other items.

But, the shrimp spring rolls is one of the best I've had anywhere! The wrapper is not thick (better for frying) nor too thin (breaks apart too easily) but just right consistency to hold everything together. The shrimp were fresh, no fishy odor nor taste to it. They don't have too much rice noodle or lettuce as fillers either. The peanut sauce is the hardest part and I think it is pretty good here. Add some hot sauce and you're good.

The place is the size of a big deli so you can eat in or take to go. The outdoor seating is nice.
author: Peter L.

description: Everything is good! The duck is amazing. I had been curious to try the sardine and no one had any reviews on it, so after trying. Here is it. It's a super fancy tuna sandwich. But of course, is sardine. If you like the flavor of banh mi and sardine, you won't be disappointed. Had a side of soup - chicken broth, kale, ginger - and it's very cleansing. I feel like if I had a bad tummy, this is what I would want to heal me.
author: Anne D.

description:
3.5 stars There aren't too many good banh mi places in FiDi but Dragon Eats fit the bill. We went right at 11:30 and there was a line but it moved fast. I ordered the five spice chicken banh mi which came with lots of pickled veggies.

Bread was soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. As my friend and I were eating, we both agreed that the five spice chicken had a milder five spice flavor than other places have.

However, the size of the sandwich and the accompaniments were good, perhaps I should have the grilled pork next time.
author: Nette T.

description:
"Dragmeats" as your credit card statement may later record it, is one of the better lunch options in SOMA. With sandwiches and bowls below $10 with tax and tip, it's a nice break from the unforgiving onslaught of $16 salad shops in the neighborhood. The menu is simple and clear - a few core ingredients prepared different ways. The option of healthy green salad or less healthy sandwich with the same flavors keeps me coming back. Overall, the roast pork has the best flavor, but is less consistent. Any chicken option is a safe one. I've found the tofu bland and strangely textured.

There's limited seating and it's usually packed over the lunch hour. Do not be discouraged by a line out the door - it moves quickly. Arrive before 11:45 for a quick (usually less than 5 minute) order.
author: Nick M.

description:
Like that Freshroll chain, but much higher quality and fresher.  A bunch of protein choices you can have in sandwich, roll or bowl form.  Unfortunately, no beef, but still some solid options.  I actually prefer Bun Mee since they're more creative (and flavorful), but DragonEats still executes well.

Duck Bánh My: Duck is really good choice for Bánh My since it's naturally fatty and a lot of that delicious grease gets absorbed by the French bread to help accumulate more flavor.  The duck meat was rich like confit, but the skin was soggy instead of crispy.  That actually worked since the bread itself had a nice crunchy texture anyway.

Shrimp Roll: Very fresh tasting.  Pretty much as expected.  The peanut sauce wasn't too thick, so it seeped nicely into the roll when dipped.

Soup: Probably the weakest link.  The ginger chicken broth was nice, but the kale was a weird a choice.  It added an unwelcome bitterness that took away form the broth's complexities.
author: Adam B.

description: Really liked their kale soup that they have daily, but after finding this dead bee in my soup, will have to unfortunately steer clear from ordering  this again.  Tried to let them know about this but no one picks up their phone when I call.
author: Kathleen R.

description: Really solid Banh Mi, especially for about $7. Because of the low price, and being my first time I wasn't sure if one would be enough, so I bought two. One was enough, however I was totally happy with my decision because I got to try the butter chicken as well as the meatball. I liked the meatball better, but both were great. Leftovers for dinner!
author: John W.

description:
Yes to quick, cheap, healthy and delicious eats!

Long lines are deceiving indeed here, food payment + pickup is ridiculously fast. 

Food: 
- Chicken avocado fresh roll: $6.50, 2 large spring rolls with a good amount of chicken + avocado to keep you full. comes with noodles, lettuce and a great peanut/hoisin sauce.
- Soup of the day $3.25: chicken + ginger broth, was a too sour for me. 

Overall, will definitely be coming back!
author: Kristie C.

description: Excellent hole in the wall Vietnamese Bahn Mi, bowls and more. I have never seen a lunch period that the line was not snaking out the door, but their fast efficient service means you never wait long. Usually they have run out of duck by the time I get there and I default to the 5 spice chicken, but today they still have duck left and it was worth the wait. My colleague selected the garlic butter chicken and we split half each. Both were excellent. Great value for SF at under $10.
author: B F.

description:
I got hungry around 10am for a bahn mi and found this place on yelp! The line was mentioned several times in other reviews and expected one when I reached the place. LUCKY ME! THE EARLY BIRD GETS THE BAHN MI!! No line! 

I ordered both the meatball and the pork bahn mi with the intent of eating one the next day. 

I had never had a meatball bahn mi before and it was delicious!! There was an amazing savory taste on the back end which I found addictive. 

The pork bahn mi was very good too!! By the time dinner rolled around I only had a half a sandwich left. The pork was tender and not a greasy as other pork bahn mi I have had. 

I am so glad I tried this place and will be back here again!
author: Deanna J.

description: It is all about that garlic butter chicken. After tax 8 bucks for a tasty sandwich, you can't go wrong. Give the garlic butter chicken a try, i don't see how a person could not like it.
author: Auza A.

description: Great sandwiches for lunch and decent prices. Get there when they open to get the duck sandwiches before they sellout.
author: R T.

description: Great lunch spot that is good and quick. I've tried the duck banh mi and the five spices chicken bowl. Both items were flavorful and good.
author: Rahman S.

description: Came here for lunch since it's close to my office and there was a line outside. It seems like a trendy place with a lot of Caucasian patrons, which made me weary. However, I felt better once I was by the cash wrap and heard the kitchen staff speak Vietnamese. At least it's made by people from the motherland. The sandwich was good, but definitely on the pricey side ($7 for a sandwich), with that price the portion could be a little bigger. It's enough for a light lunch, though.
author: Marie D.

description: Had the pork Banh Mi. The ingredients are fresh and it really tastes good. Perfect for quick pick up and go.
author: Ash M.

description: The shrimp rolls are yummy - and the portions are pretty generous too for $7.80. I thought the Vietnamese iced coffee was a bit bitter and the lunch time lines are extremely long! Overall, I really liked this place and would definitely recommend it if you're looking to try something new for lunch.
author: Sam M.

description:
A fabulous choice for a quick, affordable, and absolutely delicious lunch in SoMa. The place is tiny and if you arrive after about noon or so there will be a line out the door, but these folks are amazingly efficient and you'll get your food in no time. I was shocked - SHOCKED - that they didn't get one thing wrong in the huge order I put in for over 10 people. 

There are bowls, banh mis, rolls, and salads, and from what I remember not one thing was over $7. That's unheard of these days for high quality, handmade lunch items near offices! Vegetarians can rest easy as there are plenty of options for them too. I loved the five-spice chicken banh mi and the fresh shrimp roll. All of the ingredients were fresh and flavorful and, if I may risk sounding corny, it really felt like a lot of love went into each item. 

It's a wonderful choice for a to-go lunch during the week and I'm so glad it was recommended to me. And now I hope to pay it forward to you, dear yelper!
author: Christina P.

description:
Get:
Duck Banh Mi   - $7.50
Pork Banh Mi    - $7


A little pricey for banh mi,  but it is a SOMA lunch spot and the ingredients taste fresh.
author: Steven F.

description:
Positive: I really like the shrimp rolls here and the peanut sauce. Soup not so much as they simply sell the chicken broth for $4.00:)   

Negative: while having rolls sitting next to the window, I've seen a least 15 fruit flies. Unacceptable for the place that serves fresh food daily! I would want the food inspection services to check this place.   

Secondly, the dishwasher and some of the workers don't even speak English when asked for the bag. Are they even legal?
author: Lisa F.

description:
Came here along with what seemed like half of San Francisco for a workday lunch (while visiting SF for a work conference). The line was long but moved quickly -- they have a short and sweet menu of various banh mi, summer rolls, and a specialty soup every day.

The banh mi that I got (roasted pork) was very tasty and flavor-wise was well-balanced. The summer roll was only okay, but the peanut sauce that came with it was bomb. And the pricing is pretty good, especially because the sandwiches and rolls are quite large. I got to have a taste of the ginger chicken soup that a coworker ordered as well, and it was light and refreshing.

It's a really small space with just a few seats, but definitely a hugely popular spot for takeaway. I'd come back for a quick lunch in a heartbeat! The only thing I don't get is why they spell it as "banh my" on all the menus and signs. It's bánh mì!
author: Gretchen F.

description:
Healthy, tasty and filling -- what more can you expect?

Authentic this place is not but I do think they do a pretty good job of using fresh Vietnamese flavors in an easy to package and digestible way. I went for the five spice chicken noodle bowl which was chock full of vermicelli noodles, cooling pickled veggies, crunchy peanuts and TONS and TONS of chicken. And because SF is super cold compared to the East Coast summers I'm used to, I got a cup of their ginger broth which was so comforting and delicious.

I was lucky enough to snag a spring roll from a friend and also found it to be wonderful as well. I feel like my true blue Viet dad would also agree which is the highest compliment I can pay.

 For healthy, fresh, and affordable grubs I would look no further than DragonEats.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I was a little skeptical at first due to the "too cool, hipster" look of the place.  I'm used to banh mi being served out of hole in the wall deli look alikes.  However, the skepticism faded quickly as I took the first bite of my Duck Banh Mi (I know, I went a little fancy for banh mi, what can I saw, the look had me inspired).  The sandwich was well prepared, and although a bit on the small side, was pretty hearty and filling.  The bread was nice and crisp on the outside and soft and warm on the inside, where are the sweetness of the duck and pickled veggies were nestled, along with a ton of Jalapenos!!! $7

Also had their Ginger Chicken broth and Kale soup.  This on its own was pretty amazing.  The chicken broth tasted garlic-y, but the ginger cut that with a delicious spiciness.  The kale added substance to the soup, and it almost could make a meal on its own. $3.25

I definitely will try this place again.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Ya know what's Gluten Free. Rice Noodles. 

Guess who's gonna be eating a lot more vietnamese food in their future? 
That's a rhetorical question, sorry if I didn't make that clear. 
The answer is me. 

I wanted to get one of their "Fresh bowls" with the rice noodles, and put shrimp on it. Cause everything else would have been GF. And the guy wouldn't let me. Which is fine! I mean... if you don't make adaptations to your menu, that's fine with me. Everyplace does not have to be Burger King. Sometimes, you just can't have it your way. I'm fine with that. 

It was just kind of the way he said it and was really cold to me before and after. 
Now granted there was a really long behind me, and the place was pretty weeded. But it just kinda made me a little uncomfortable how blunt and cold he was about our interaction. Outside of that, everything was splendiferous. 

So he told me that the salads were GF, and I ended up getting the salad with shrimp. WHICH I LOVED. I mean.. I really freakin' loved that salad. I got to taste someone else's spring roll ( rice paper FTW), and it was also REALLY good. 

I kept on talking about it for the rest of the day. I kind of wanted to go back later in the week even. 

If there was a dragoneats in my area, you'd see me there a lot! 

Such a great spot for a quick, easy, filling, cheap lunch. Wish I just had a little warmer service.
author: Mike B.

description: Visit sf for a couple days. Found this small surprising deli place in downtown! I had green salad with shrimp. It was delicious and most important thing is the perfect size! Good for a nutritious lunch and won't take too much blood from your brain like most heavy meal does.
author: Jun T.

description:
Sometimes I get really territorial about my food. I'm a vegetarian surrounded by people who aren't who like to order lots of (meat-filled) things to share with each other. So whenever I get to order something purely vegetarian, I don't share because, let's face it, I'd never be able to eat my own food. Darn gluttonous carnivores all up in my meal.

Also, I tend to avoid a lot of places because it can be stressful to stress that I'm a vegetarian. So when I heard a group of friends were heading over to DragonEats, and that it was Vietnamese, I instantly got nervous (#fishsauceproblems).

But this proved to be one of the best/easiest vegetarian lunch experiences I've ever had: they organically offer vegetarian options for the the bánh mìs, bowls, rolls, and salads, AND you specify (and if you don't, they'll ask) whether you want fish or soy sauce. This is a dream come true.

Everything is between $6 and $7. WHATTTTTT!?! Suh cheap.

And the portions are actually perfect for lunch. I ordered the teriyaki tofu bowl (which came with rice noodles, pickled celery, daikon, and carrots, cilantro [a little too much for me, but I'm one of "those" people], roasted peanuts, and crispy shallots) and a teriyaki tofu roll (which had rice noodles, red leaf lettuce, and mint) because I was unsure if either would be filling enough. Two things:
1. There was plenty of food... the slabs of tofu are thick and hearty, and they don't skimp on the other ingredients either. Going back to paragraph one: I made it very clear that I wouldn't be sharing my rolls (since I never get to enjoy this kind of thing)... and in the end, I did, because there really was enough to go around (and vegetarians are nicer, anyway).
2. Both items were DELICIOUS. And, somehow, despite being almost exactly the same thing (except one was deconstructed and one wasn't)... they actually tasted different! What kind of magic is that? Peanut sauce was delish, and don't forget to load up on sriracha!

Sure the queue can grow long, but it moves through quickly. Knowing all this, I will absolutely be making this a regular stop when I'm in San Francisco for work, and until then will pout as my little corner of the world doesn't have anything quite like this. Le sigh.
author: Steff D.

description:
I'm the type of person that likes to eat often in small amounts, so I usually have leftovers when I go out to eat. So these sandwiches are perfect! I think other people like to get 1.5 or 2 sandwiches to really be full off these, so order accordingly! It's about the size of a 6" sub.

I ordered the duck, but I hate cilantro (one of those people) and also cucumbers (yeah I wish i liked them too) so I asked those to be taken out and replaced with something else. I wasn't sure if theyd do it because.. if you're ordering bahn mi without cilantro and cucumber.. unclear what you're doing (i went because I wanted to try it anywayy) but they were super nice and made me a special sandwich. 

and i loved it!! perfect sweet and salty balance, and the duck was amazingg. 

price, serving size, service, flavor: all awesome. 

Limited seating area though!
author: Grace P.

description: $7.25 for the best, freshest bahn mi in SOMA. The cashiers are super nice and engaging. I'm friends with one!  He knows my order by heart!  5/5.
author: Matt H.

description:
I crave banh mi on a regular basis, and DragonEats is my go to spot in the area. They have a great roasted pork "banh-my" packed with pickled daikon/carrots, cilantro, chiles, and pate... all at the awesome price of only $6.

They also serve a solid papaya salad and make a delicious nuoc cham (sauce) to go with it. 

Once I got the soup of the day (more like the soup every day), which was ginger chicken soup w/ kale, and I was very pleasantly surprised. Never thought I'd see kale in pho ga broth but it was really good!

Fresh rolls, also good. Vietnamese iced coffee, just alright. It's not individually brewed through a drip filter like what they serve at restaurants, but I like everything else here so I can't complain
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description:
Possibly the best lunch spot in all of San Francisco. I'm serious, they have everything you could ever want. 

Duck Bahn Mi, Hands down OUT OF THIS WORLD. AMAZING.

Meatball Bahn Mi, good but not my particular fave, but still very good.

The kale broth soup -- uh YES it's a great side and also it makes me feel healthy... I'm serious.

The cabbage salad with shrimp was a SHOCKER, I was not expecting it to be so good. Comes with fish sauce (always on the side) and you can request a side of peanut sauce (do it) and it's the most delicious salad... on the planet? 


Nothing here is boring or lacking flavor, everything is made to perfection and they really know how to pair flavors. GO HERE! The line moves crazy fast, and you will have forgotten about it the second you take your first bite. Ugh I wish I could go here every day.....
author: Molli W.

description:
Ordered the duck banh mi, it was amazing. The duck was soft, tender, and flavorful. They include pickled veggies and a sweet and sour sauce, for a diverse range of tastes in a single sandwich. 

The sandwich was a bit smaller than I liked for a full lunch meal, but it was fairly priced in SOMA. Would recommend for a more complete meal to add a soup to their banh mis.
author: Matt W.

description:
Bahn Mi does not get better than this!  Holy Molly if it does then you need to take me there now.

The place has a line out the door at Lunch and you can get away for less than $10, which is the equivalent of stealing in SoMa these days.

Check this place out.  It is worth the walk and the wait.  But get 2 sandos if you are hungry...I suggest the Duck, 5 Spice Chicken and the Pork Meatball.
author: Lee S.

description:
Delicious and such a good value! Definitely hard to come by these days in the city. The line during peak hours can get very long, but they've got a very efficient system going so it moves pretty fast. They've got a relatively simple menu consisting of sandwiches, bowls, and spring rolls. Most things on the menu are under $7, which is great! I was pretty hungry, and I heard that the sandwich is more filling than the bowl, so I went for the 5-spice chicken sandwich. Got my food in about 5 minutes, and considering the number of people before me, that was pretty impressive. 

The sandwich was delicious! It wasn't as big as I was expecting, but it's still quite filling so I'm not complaining. They've got a good meat to veggie ratio, and the chicken had so much flavor I was surprised! The meat was tender, and the sauce accompanying the chicken complemented it really well. The veggies that they use have that pickled taste, and along with the cilantro, they balance out the rich flavor of the meat. The sandwich is filling, but not heavy, if that makes sense. The texture of the bread was prefect. Really nothing bad to say about this place. I'll definitely be back to try some of their other menu items in the near future!
author: Ashley Y.

description:
A nice little hidden spot on the border of FiDi. Perfect for a cheap, fast lunch (everything is made to go but they do have some indoor seating). I've only had the fresh bowl and will try the bun mi eventually. 5 spice chicken is better than the pork, but they're both good. 

The size of the container is deceiving, as it looks big but it's only about half full.... Decent amount of meat but I feel like they skimp out on the noodles and add lots of lettuce instead. Overall it's tasty but I usually have to eat something in addition because I'm still hungry. 

Would give it 3 stars since portions are so small but 1 extra star for cleanliness and price. $6?! Sure why not.
author: Steph D.

description: I have been a patron since their early days. The price has barely gone up $1 in three years. Thanks for still being one of the few affordable lunch options in SOMA. I have tried Ban Mi in a few different places but this would still remain the best Bahn Mi I've had in the bay. I specifically love zucchini cuts in the sandwich. My one knock on them is that the sandwich is a bit small and is usually not filling.
author: Saideep S.

description:
You MUST try the 5-spice Chicken Fresh Bowl! It comes with a container of clear fish sauce that you pour over the bowl before eating. I couldn't have wanted more--fresh flavors, perfectly cooked chicken, vermicelli noodles of just the right density...I'll be back soon!! At about $7/bowl, it's a great lunch option for expensive San Francisco.

Etc.:
+ They make their own homemade coffee and lemonade!
+ Sriracha and water cups available on the side bar
+ No line at 11:30am on a weekday. If you come any later than 11:45-12, you'll definitely have to wait in a line behind about 5-10 people.
+ Very fast service--both ordering & getting the food!
+ 2 doors down from a chocolate place with free samples--dessert, anyone?
author: Melanie W.

description: Stumbled on this place while riding through San Francisco (I'm from Texas) due to the number of people pouring in.  We had the soup of the day, pork bowl, and shrimp fresh rolls.  It was all very good and fast.  I can see why it's a favorite.   I'd stop here without hesitation if you're looking for good viet food!
author: John H.

description:
DragonEats is my jam! My coworkers and I come here every week, and depending on my mood I'll either get a banh mi, shrimp spring rolls, or the five spice chicken bowl (if I'm feeling healthy). Everything is around $6-8. The line moves relatively quickly and I've never had to wait long, even during peak hours.

My favorite item: the garlic butter chicken breast banh mi. MMM GET THAT. 

Their Vietnamese iced coffee is strong but expensive! I would pass on the broth soup. I wish the chicken bowl was a little more filling but for the price point, it's still a great deal and makes for a light lunch. The banh mis are probably the most bang for your buck.

I crave this place all the time.
author: Valerie L.

description:
As lunch places go in FiDi, this is a very solid choice. I read a bunch of reviews on this place and decided I was going to come here to try the Five Spice Chicken Banh Mi. My sandwich was between $7-$8 and a good portion for me for lunch. It wasn't so big to make me lethargic from food coma, but it wasn't small enough to leave me still hungry after eating the whole thing. Also, I came at about noon and the line wasn't too bad and moved pretty quickly.

This place is also rated one of the best places to get banh mi in FiDi, which is why I came to check it out. I would say based on the few places I've tried (disclaimer), that's true - based on the price and quality. Bun Mee is a little more expensive and the other place I like is Cafe Dolci. I've also heard good things about the quality of the vietnamese coffee - they have Cafe Du Monde all over the place. If you like Cafe Du Monde coffee, you're in for a treat. 

The ratio of meat to bread was good. The five spice chicken is very flavorful, and they didn't overload on veggies. They also put pate in the sandwich, which made it extra delicious. The jalapenos were cut thin, so it wasn't overly spicy. Overall a pretty good banh mi sandwich. I'd like to come back and try some of the other items here, like the Roasted Pork and Roasted Duck banh mi sandwiches.
author: Lin Z.

description:
Overall, I would come again since it is so close to my office. The line was long, but it goes by fast.

I got a pork banh mi and an order of tofu rolls to share with my co-worker.

The pork was nice and tender and flavorful, but there were small things that I wish were better. The pickled carrots were very sour. It had a good crunch, but it need a little more acid to make it perfect. The mayo was bland and could be a little sweeter. The pate was almost undetectable in tasty even though i saw it. I do like that they put the chilies on the side.

The main thing is that the bread was a little heavy. It wasn't as fluffy as a traditional bahi mi should be.

I can't eat shrimp, so I got the tofu rolls and it had good flavorful, I only wish that I tasted more herbs and bean sprout.  It went well with the fish sauce, but at $6 for 2 rolls, meaning each one is $3, it is a bit pricy.

I grew up with little paris as a kid and cam huong in college, and I am a little spoiled when it comes to my Vietnamese sandwich. Anything over $4 has to be amazing.
author: Mei L.

description: This hole in the wall Vietnamese family restaurant is one of the BEST in the city. Great prices, super fast service and delicious Banh Mis. Five spice chicken is an all-time favorite, but don't miss out on the shrimp rolls either!!!
author: Celia L.

description: One of the better spots for Bahn mi. They just raised their prices but still pretty reasonable.
author: Gary M.

description:
3.5 stars for affordable and decent rating bahn mi and spring rolls. 

Prefer fresh roll but this is a decent option too.
author: Jess C.

description:
Tldr Fresh Roll in Soma is way better. Yes it's a bit cheaper here but the portions are way less and the five spice chicken I had was pretty dry/not flavorful. I got the bowl option and it barely had any noodles.

The lines are long, but it definitely moves fast. During peak lunch time it gets really packed inside. Overall I wasn't very impressed and again, would recommend either Fresh Roll Vietnamese or Tin.
author: Sophia H.

description: Been here multiple times. Food has almost always tasted great. I like the roasted pork banh mi. I stay away from the chicken cause I feel they boil it and the juices go into their soups. I liked their soups in the past. This time though, got an unwelcome roach in my soup. :(
author: Alton Y.

description:
DragonEats banh mi sandwiches taste a lot more fresh than many other banh mi places I've tried before. I got the roast pork banh mi and it had a pretty good meat to vegetable to bread ratio, although it was a bit messy to eat and not evenly distributed across the sandwich. When I bit into it I got either all vegetable or all meat and had to use my fingers or a knife to get an even distribution. If you are thirsty, they have infused water that you can fill into provided cups. 

As for the venue, it is a nice little restaurant with several bar stools and an industrial theme, located within view of the bay bridge. However, there is no bathroom provided so I had to wash my hands by wetting a paper napkin with water. 

The people who work there are all Vietnamese and mainly speak Vietnamese to each other.
author: Zach C.

description:
Great food, great prices! Arrived when the line was pretty long and snaking out the door, but it did not take long to get to the front, order, and receive the food (especially considering the number of people there). I couldn't decide between the five spices chicken or the pork banh my sandwich, but the guy at the register recommended the pork with great confidence and I'm so glad I took his recommendation - it was delicious!! Compared to other Vietnamese sandwiches, this one really stands out as being near the top. I love that the was stuffed full with pork, and that the pork itself was tender and juicy. Just the right amount of carrots, daikon, cucumber, and sauce to balance out the rest of the flavors. The bread was soft and the whole sandwich tasted very fresh! 

The sandwich was $6.50 and most other items on the menu were priced around the same. The line stayed pretty long the entire time I was there, and I'm guessing that it's pretty popular every day too (especially around lunch time). Overall, I was impressed. I'd definitely come back again!
author: Kathy C.

description: Compared to the expensive and frankly not very tasty choices in sf.. this place is solid.. would I compare it to little Saigon in south San Jose? No, but the soup was fragrant and the sandwhich was ok..  the bread was a bit hard.. almost a hard roll vs what I would typically expect from a soft banh mi roll
author: John K.

description:
DragonEats is one of those places that meets the near-mythical downtown SF trifecta of cheap, tasty, and within (actual) walking distance. It's not quuuiiite FiDi, but certainly SoMa, and offers Vietnamese fare - banh mis, bowls, and wraps. And at roughly $7 or so for a banh mi, is a heck of a deal. Any day where I can get lunch for less than $10 is a victory. 

I got the 5 spices chicken banh mi, after waiting in a somewhat long but fast moving line with the rest of the lunch crowd. I got there a bit before noon though, and thank goodness for that, because no sooner had I scored a seat was the line out the door and wrapping around the corner. Jeesh.

But anyway. The banh mi came out fast and was pretty dang good - the chicken tasty, the mayo well-proportioned and not overwhelming, and the carrots, cilantro, etc all well-balanced. The baguette was delightfully crispy in the outside and fluffy on the inside, and I was pretty full by the end of it. If you're at a really authentic Vietnamese place somewhere in a Little Vietnam or Chinatown, you'll be spoiled by your $3.50 banh mi, but for downtown SF this place is a bargain. Definitely try it out.
author: Sara K.

description:
DragonEats is a great place to stop and get some solid Vietnamese food. 

I have tried several of the  choices and the chicken and porch options both bun mi and bowls were very good.

Price is also nice! 

Dont miss it...
author: Steven W.

description:
Decent banh mi for a good price (in SF at least). The roasted pork banh mi was smaller than the average, but the pork was pretty flavorful! It was a filling enough sandwich but I probably could have eaten more with it and still not be stuffed so maybe get two things if you're feeling really hungry. I also came here for lunch and it was PACKED! It's a pretty small place with one counter where the food is coming out so everyone was crowded around that area. They also just called out numbers for orders that were ready, but the guy was definitely not loud enough for us to hear because we were standing at the edge of the mob. 

Overall, I would come here again for lunch for the decent prices and how close it is to my office, but the banh mi was pretty average! Also, my friend got a fresh bowl and she said it barely had any noodles in it so -1!
author: Grace C.

description:
Tasty!
Went there for lunch with co-workers and was delighted. Line was little long, but at 6$ for a sandwich, this was a great choice. The sandwich itself was little spicy but it was very juicy. One is probably enough for a decent lunch meal
author: Arjan N.

description:
This place is my JAM.

I'm a fan of the 5 spice chicken banh mi. The mayo is perfectly creamy and the bread is crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside. The salads are super refreshing and delicious but definitely overpriced. I still get them though, they're just a great compliment to the sandwiches.

I also had the cafe sua da aka Vietnamese iced coffee. It tasted bitter and burnt - I don't think they use condensed milk but I could be wrong.

-1 star for their spring rolls. I've never had a shrimp spring roll with salad mix in it. Weird. 

There's always a line during the lunch rush but it moves fast and you get your food promptly.
author: T L.

description:
This place needs a cool logo, I mean who doesn't like Dragons right? 

Spring rolls and the bowl are what I've tried here and it's pretty darn good. Wait can take awhile but that's to be expected. Pricing is pretty good for the area as well.
author: Rod M.

description:
Hmm. My shrimp roll looks great but it actually has way too much lettuce in it. I get choked (by lettuce) after every bite. They give you one container of sauce. It is watered down. I hate watered down sauce. I've had their banh mi and it's pretty good but not great.

Not a lot of seating so come after the lunch crowd dies down. 

3.5
author: x x.

description: Really good rolls, good flavor in the bowl but small portion size. It's probably a more appropriate portion size for I should be eating. Pretty quick too.
author: Delisa R.

description:
Fresh ingredients, neat space, delicious food. I ordered the fresh rolls and a bahn mi thinking that the rolls would be appetizer portions but both were enough to be meals on their own! 

The rolls were good, standard vietnamese spring rolls (or summer rolls or whatever they're called). The true star was the pork bahn mi.....juicy chunks of pork and crispy cucumber with a delicious sauce all held within a crunchy baguette. Wow. 

The line gets long but seems to move pretty fast. I will definitely be back to try more things. Seriously, at 6 dollars this is a great place to go for lunch!
author: Kat T.

description: Superb Vietnamese food, clean, kind and welcoming staff. After recently returning from Vietnam I can say this spot is better than the food I ate there :) a 10 plus plus!!!
author: P S.

description:
Yummm! Cute little spot my manager dragged me to today for lunch! I never would've wander this far from FiDi for it otherwise!

I ordered the Garlic Butter Chicken Banh My..it was good because the chicken is shredded, but you have to reallocate it for each bite, or else it might be too much in one chunk. They add jalepenos, which gave it a nice kick. I generally love banh mi, but all the sandwiches in FiDi don't really have enough stuff in them..or they're too dry. But this place uses really good bread and adds plenty of veggies and meat. I would compare this to a way more gourmet/upscale Lee's sandwich backed with some serious quality in their meats.

MUST come back for their Fresh Rolls and Bowls...I saw a TON of people ordering the bowls today!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I swear I wrote a review for this place when it first opened and posted a photo of the pork bahn-my and kale soup I had, but I couldn't find it so perhaps it was constructed memory!

This is my favorite lunch spot in the city on the weekdays. Everything (except drinx) is $6 and made of fresh ingredients daily. The staff members are so friendly and I just feel like I'm at home. (Just kidding, my home does not feel like that.) 

I've actually tried almost everything on the menu except the La Sardine and Tekiyaki Tofu banh-my. I personally do not think bahn-mys should be created without meat. Lucky you, vegetarians though; this place disagrees.

My favorite item is the roasted pork fresh bowl. It's very filling, not too heavy and delicious. The soup of the day is really good too. (fyi - kale soup is always the soup of the day.) I'd recommended coming around 11:30 or at 1:00p to beat the lunch rush; it can get kind of crowded.
author: Juliana P.

description: Everything here cost about $6.50 each- you have the option to select from a Banh Mi- sandwich, spring roll, or noodle bowl.   I can honestly say shrimp rolls is one of the best I've ever had!  The lettuce in the shrimp rolls had been previously mixed with a great mayo based sauce?  The peanut dipping sauce is great as well.  The pork sandwich is quite tasty with the pickled veggies.  My bread was a bit too hard but other than than and the fact that they are not open on the weekend- it's a great lunch spot to grab and go.  Will be back to try out their bowls. =)
author: Melanie N.

description: DragonEats is right up the street from where I work, so it's definitely a place I've frequented many times. I usually opt for their Dragon Bowl with the Five Spice Chicken.  The bowl is usually just enough food for me, albeit maybe a tad on the small side.  I recently had the Dragon Roll with shrimp and definitely like that wasn't enough food for lunch.  That being said, I enjoy the simplicity of their menu and service being pretty fast.  The line here can get long, so coming before 12pm ensures you won't have to wait that long.  I've heard good things about their Bahn Mi sandwiches as well, especially the duck.
author: Lisa I.

description: Hayes Valley STAPLE for anyone needing fast and delicious quality food. Everything on the menu is solidly great. (The soup is very simple and shockingly good -- great if you are feeling under the weather) Inexpensive and never at the expense of the quality of their product. Line can be long at lunch sometimes but it generally moves pretty fast. Thank you, Dragon Eats!
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Concise menu offering enough variety for everyone
Flavors are present and delightful 
Portions are fair in comparison to price 

Overall Thoughts

Food is fresh, vibrant, and satisfying
author: Eddie W.

description:
I love this place, the pork meat ball bahn mi was excellent! Spring roll was super fresh, the rice paper was tender and almost gooey.

Come a bit early for lunch, the crowd gets huge by noon.

A few spots to eat here, but once the crowd arrives it's more pleasant to take it to go.
author: Patrick S.

description: The absolute BEST banh my I've every had!!! The line gets longer with each visit too!
author: Mr S.

description:
This, this is the place that I've always dreamed of, amazing food thats light and delicious, cheap prices, and you get your food fairly quickly despite long lines.

The roasted duck sandwich is amazing, absolutely amazing, if this place was right by work I would literally go everyday, I mean, it's kinda far from the office and I'd still go everyday!

I hope this place never close down, and they always serve the same quality of food at the same reasonable prices.
author: Davis W.

description:
The co-worker and I usually venture out to try something different at least a couple of times a week and when we came across DragonEats we had no idea what we were in store for. We have walked by this place a couple of times not having a clue that food was served here. From the outside it looks like a swanky coffee and pastry shop. 

So when we walked by the other day at lunch time and we saw the line out the door we knew we had stumbled upon something other than another artisan hipster coffee spot in the SOMA. We decided to let the crowd die down and come back after 1 pm and when we got back there were only a handful of people left inside. 

We ordered a Garlic butter chicken and a Pork meatball Bahn My's (which the very pleasant counter person stated that were his personal favorites) and awaited our number to be called. We grabbed a couple of glasses of their cucumber infused ice water that is free of charge and quite refreshing and took a seat. When our order came up we popped open the wrappers and traded halves of each of our sandwiches so we could both experience the way of the Dragon. 

The smells these sammie's were emitting were intoxicating. The contrasting green and orange colors from the shredded carrots and the cilantro and jalapeños was very appeasing to the eye. The crust and crunch on the bread was perfect and my goodness the chicken and pork were seasoned to perfection. All of this for $6 each?!?  

What's the catch? There's not one from what I can see as we have since come back and tried the 5 spice chicken and the Roasted pork. They were also good but I think I will go back to our original choices when we first ventured in but I also won't hesitate to try other options on the menu such as the Fresh Rolls and Bowls. 

Great friendly service, cool atmosphere and a tremendous value in this area of the FiDi / SOMA. We shall return!
author: Josh H.

description: I'll start by saying that I am a big Vietnamese food enthusiast, and DragonEats is as good as it gets. First of all, the price is right. Second of all, the fresh rolls are to die for. After I came here for the first time a couple of years ago, I couldn't help but come every day for lunch during the work week since it is a quick walk from my office, incredibly delicious and fast. I order the same thing every time- the shrimp rolls and the chicken avocado rolls. One order is never enough for me because they are just THAT GOOD. Toan is the owner/manager and he is the friendliest, nicest person and makes my lunch hour that much more enjoyable every single day. The other thing I love about DragonEats is how consistent it is. I never feel like I'm getting skimpy portions or that they have ever failed to deliver me exactly what I expect on a daily basis.
author: Natalie S.

description: Best tofu banh mi I've had. It's a really good lunch spot in soma. Expect long lines if you go during peak lunch time but the line does move fast. I've tried the tofu fresh roll as well and would give that a thumbs up too. I wouldn't recommend sitting and eating there as it's quite small and can get very noisy.
author: Jeel J.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots in SOMA. It's quick and easy! My favorites are the duck bahn mi and the shrimp rolls. Order the iced coffee if you need an afternoon boost!
author: C Y.

description:
Absolutely delicious. I needed a quick place to grab lunch during a conference I was attending in town, and found this place just a quick walk down the street from my hotel. At first I was a little concerned as the line was out the door, but I quickly realized how fast it was moving. It took me less than 10 minutes to order my food, and it was out in less than 5. It's fast.
