I got the duck bahn my, and it was perfect. The duck was super tender and cooked perfectly. The veggies were fresh, and is was all drenched in the perfect amount of sweet and sour sauce. The bread around might actually be the best part. Crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside.

Highly recommend.
author: Dylan L.

description:
Got the garlic chicken banh mi. Pretty solid. However, not very filling. 

Great iced coffee. They use cafe du monde coffee.
author: Faiz S.

description: I was really excited about this place because 1) inexpensive 2) portions are decent but when i was eating my sandwich today I realized there was a bug crawling around on my wrapper (after I opened it up). It may be one of those bugs that is from the cilantro but not cool. This just means they don't clean it well enough. I'm huge on sanitation and that's just gross.
author: Pierre L.

description:
I came here once last week, as it's in SOMA near the office, and I seriously haven't been able to stop thinking about it. It was recommended to me by a fellow Yelper, who goes every day and has become best friends with Toan (the manager?) I used to laugh at how often she would go (she's currently the Yelp Duchess of DragonEats) but now I get it.

Their spring rolls are so fresh, and the dipping sauce that they come with is heavenly. They are light, but filling. Plus, the rice noodles inside....mmmm....so fluffy and delicious. Also, don't skip their lemonade, it's AMAZING. And, I've heard good things about their coffee too.

At $6.50 a meal, that's pretty awesome for this city. And, you leave feeling totally satisfied but not too full. Perfect workday meal. I hope I make it back here before I leave SF.
author: Brooke S.

description: I am addicted to the 5 Spice chicken sandwich. This is my must go to place when I'm in San Fransico!!!
author: Rafael T.

description: 1st time there today line was long but they were still moving fast and the Duck sandwhich  is now one of my top things to eat! amazing! must try its spicy 1 star from perfect since price is about 7.25 but def worth it!
author: Jay A.

description: Would definitely recommend the duck banh mi before it runs out. Also try to get in line before 12:10 to avoid the rush.
author: Riley M.

description: I have tried tofu teryaki banh my here and I really liked it. Also during peak times like lunch they are pretty quick. All the menu items are very decently priced but a few weeks ago they announced prices will go high a bit.
author: Ameneh G.

description:
i came here with some friends during lunch and the line was out the door! but don't be deceived, the line moves quickly and you get your order fast too! i ordered a five spice chicken fresh bowl for $7.07 (including tax) but the portion size is a bit small. unlike fresh rolls, you know this place is authentic because all their employees are vietnamese. i really enjoyed my fresh bowl, tho i wish they gave me a bit more noodles because i was hungry after an hour :( the five spice chicken was delicious! i'll come back to try their banh mi! i definitely prefer dragon eats over fresh roll.

notes: it's a small shop and it gets really crowded, so i would recommend sitting in the outdoor area at 303 2nd street! this place seems like a popular spot, so expect long lines but it moves quickly! if you have a big appetite like me and you plan to get a fresh bowl, i would recommend getting something else along with it haha. definitely worth a try if you're up for banh mi or fresh bowls.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Yummy rolls and banh but the banh mi was lacking a solid amount of meat. Would be 5 star if filled w more meat and less carrots lol
author: Natalia G.

description: Very good bahn mi here, based on the pork one I just had. Good bread, with crunch outside, soft inside, not too dry, very tasty pork, good balance of the meat with the vegetable part, hot jalapeno. Overall very good, and best I've had recently.
author: Bruce C.

description:
Small & cozy spot with authentic banhmi. It  reminded me a lot of what I had in Vietnam. 

I went with the pork banhmi and it was fantastic. I want to try the duck next time. 

These are decent sized sandwiches that's perfect for a lunch. Bread was nicely done and the fillings were exactly what you expect from a legit Vietnamese sandwich shop. 

They also have a bowl option for the sandwiches. But why would you want to skip the bread? Get those sit-ups in. #iworkouttoeat
author: Christopher S.

description: Pretty cheap for this kind of food. I tried the teriyaki tofu salad (with cabbage), and it was pretty tasty. I could definitely taste the different flavors, but personally I thought the teriyaki had an interesting consistency & texture to it. Nonetheless, it was a satisfying snack for me. next time, I'll have to get the banh mi!
author: Cheri C.

description:
The rundown: we yelped this place bc it was so close to our Airbnb while visiting SF. It's fast, it's delicious, the people are friendly, there's no room to sit so take it to go. Want more? Read on! 

I didn't realize this place was tiny, so it probably wasn't the best place to go with a group and my 1 yo daughter, but it was worth it! My husband had the chicken and I had the pork bahn mi, my sister and her hubby had the pork & duck combination (my daughter loved it, too). I def vote for the pork. We also tried the house soup with kale, onion, and ginger and that was delicious. 

Limited drink options, diet/coke, sprite, homemade lemonade, and Vietnamese coffee. Go for the coffee!! 

Overall, probably not a destination spot, but if you're in the area, probably best during an off-time of day, give it a try.
author: Shannon L.

description:
enjoyed the tofu spring rolls

healthy, fast, cheap, great sauce.
author: Pavan K.

description: I love the bahn mis here!! The tofu sandwich is delicious every time, and very reasonable at $6.75. The wait is never as long as it looks like it might be, but it can be difficult to distinguish the line from the people waiting. The only thing to know is that the bread, though toasted, can get a bit soggy so it's best to eat it right away.
author: Amber H.

description:
The tofu bowls and sandwiches are super yummy and only $6.50.  Their iced coffee is delish and helps get me through the afternoon - worth splurging on sometimes.

The line moves along really quickly, so don't be discouraged if you see a line out the door.  Not a lot of seating and it's noisy AF when the place gets packed.

Pro tip: the trash is outside.
author: Virginia L.

description: The lunch line moved pretty quickly. The banh mi was packed full of goodies. The veges were very fresh and crunchy and the pork was delicious. Beware, it does drip. Overall, it was an outstanding banh mi.
author: James S.

description:
Quick service, tasty banh mi, decent prices.

I tried their shrimp fresh spring roll ($6) first, nothing special, and the peanut dipping sauce didn't do much to help.  

Next I tried the Le Sardine sandwich ($6) which was great.  Good balance of meat and veggies, just enough dressing, very tasty.  Their jalapeños aren't cut too thick either, which is a peeve of mine.

I'll definitely add them to my regular lunch spot rotation, especially if I'm in the mood for something light and healthy.
author: Carlin F.

description:
Pretty good banh mi for a good price for the location. For about $7 you can get your sandwich with your choice of meat. I usually get the pork, but there are about 5 other options. It's the typical size of any Vietnamese sandwich restaurant. 

The line moves pretty quick during lunch time so it's not that long of a wait. Don't be scared by the line because they have a lot of workers preparing the items.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I used to be a fan and major supporter of this small business. Not only is it close to my work, they have healthy-ish options and make the food fast. Up until today they offered my colleagues and I a small discount on food and beverage. 

I'm not a huge discount person, but when they first opened the owner came by and asked (read: begged) to try them out, offering a discount for our patronage, I did my best to support during the lunch time rush. 

However, today when I showed my badge I was met with attitude and rudeness for even asking for the discount my colleagues and I have been getting for over a year.

To add insult to injury they decided to talk about me in Vietnamese as I was waiting for my paid in full food. I KNOW CONVERSATIONAL SHIT TALKING IN VIETNAMESE YOU JERKS! Sharing bad words and insults in many languages was sport in my school days. 

They also gave me the wrong sandwich. 

I guess this is really how it goes in SF these days. Once you no longer need those who have supported you from day one you keep it moving. Here's to more entitled and forgetful SF businesses. 

Needless to say I will never eat here again.
author: Ashley J.

description:
So cheap so good - 6$ lunch in downtown SF? What more could you ask more.

Banh mi sandwiches seemed great although I tried the bowl. Their Vietnamese iced coffee is rich and tasty.

Not too much place to sit inside so prepare to bump into other people inside while you await your order.
author: Sep N.

description: I love this place. Each new city I visit with Vietnamese sandwiches I have to try the classic pork and this one defines how I think they should taste. Can't wait to go back.
author: Phillip W.

description: You can't beat their prices and the food is delicious. Great place for grab and go food here in soma.
author: Beni R.

description: Solid Vietnamese bowls, and very fairly priced. You can lunch and dinner for 15 dollars here essentially. It's not anything crazy as far as taste but hits the spot once in awhile.
author: Rohan S.

description:
Good stuff. Bit of an oddball layout inside, though, with the massive table in the middle. The line was out the door but it was worth waiting the 10 mins. Everything moved along quite quickly. 

Authentic taste, fresh ingredients and a really nice staff. If you're hungry, grab a sandwich. The noodle bowls are a sufficient amount but it doesn't give you that same level of satisfaction.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Stumbled upon this Viet sandwich banh mi place when we were walking through the City. Wasn't going to stop but smelled really good and went in. Glad we did.

I got the four spice chicken banh mi sandwich for $6. Decently priced for the size. The bread was made fresh. 

I did like their POS - they used Clover and you sign on a tablet. Like you'd expect in SF. Service was friendly and sandwiches came out quick though we were there at 11am on a weekday so wasn't really peak hrs.
author: Darryl I.

description: Fresh healthy lunch for those who want a cheap alternative. I've personally never tried the Bahn Mi but the 5 spice chicken bowl is super delicious and if you're still hungry after that, I would also recommend the shrimp spring rolls. The rolls comes with a container of peanut sauce that I sometimes like to mix with my bowl (along with the mandatory Sriracha). The place is fairly small so it may be difficult to get a place to sit if you're coming in a team of 3 or more.
author: Mandy C.

description: SOoooooOOOOO delicious! I took the papaya shrimp and the soup and I want seconds!
author: Cristina C.

description: This was the first meal I had in SF, and I definitely chose well. The meatball banh mi I got was delicious, nice and moist with a variety of delicious flavors. The price was excellent as well, and the portions are adequate. My only criticism is that it closes early during the week and isn't open on the weekends.
author: Shawn W.

description: YES. Get the Butter Chicken banh mi. Soooo good. Line moves fast, but I recommend cruising in before lunch rush so there's even less wait. Super fresh. Always good. I love this sandwich so much that I haven't tried any of the other flavors. My friend go the pork banh mi, loved it as well.
author: Amy O.

description:
Met up with a group of friends here for lunch one day & had high hopes based off the reviews... but honestly, I think it was just OK. 

As expected for anywhere in FIDI - there was a lunch rush - but it wasn't too bad. I think we waited maybe 5-10 minutes and we ordered. I got the duck banh mi based off of the raving reviews & you wait for your number to be called. It doesn't take too long for them to make - about 10 minutes - depending on how many people are there I guess. 

There's not much or a sitting area so we just decided to go to a communal sitting area nearby to enjoy our sandwiches. I was expected a lot more flavor in he duck and veggies - but it was lacking in everything. There wasn't enough duck, there wasn't enough veggies & there wasn't enough flavor. I was disappointed right when I unraveled the paper - it was flat looking & a bit bland. 

I wouldn't opt to come here on my own again - but wouldn't mind if a friend chose this place.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Asian Fusion is popular around the country. One of the first things I noticed when I moved to SF from LA is that while LA has a huge Korean fusion scene, SF's focus seems to be with Vietnamese fusion. It's clearly a fad and many Vietnamese fusion restaurants will not make it in the long run.

Dragon Eats has more merit than most other contenders. The banh mi here is seasoned well and uncompromising on flavor. The ginger chicken soup packs in the punch. Compared to other SOMA options, the food seems very affordable. Of course, when you compare Dragon Eats to more authentic Vietnamese restaurants, the prices here are much higher.
author: Yi Z.

description: I still prefer Saigon Sandwich where I can get a tofu banh mi for $3.75 tax included. However, when I am short on time, I get my banh mi fix - vegetarian tofu style at DragonEats ($6.57 including tax). It's a bit overpriced compared to nearby Tenderloin establishments, but they definitely know how to make a banh mi. I would recommend NOT going there exactly at 12pm b/c the line is out the door. Come around 11am or after 1pm to beat the lunch crowd. Plus points for taking credit card and being fast even when there's a line. Limited seating space, crowded, and noisy. A grab and go place. No restrooms.
author: Tina C.

description:
Awesome spot for lunch. I've had pork, 5 spice chicken, and the duck banh my which were all great, as well as the bowl. Tastes really fresh and healthy, although the sandwiches are a little oily which quickly dispels that notion. Prices are cheap, but I found that usually one banh my isn't quite filling enough for lunch - getting three and splitting 1.5 each with a friend is pretty key. 

The line is usually long but moves quick, although this place has probably the most poorly designed interior/line management I've seen in my life, be prepared to bump into people or excuse yourself about fifty times in the process of ordering and getting your food.

Also their credit card merchant name is hilarious. Seeing "DRAGMEATS" on my CC bill the day after I eat at DragonEats makes me laugh every time.
author: Victor S.

description:
I kind of want to make a game of thrones reference...

Okay, I'm giving 5 stars for consistency, price and overall extreme deliciousness of their Bahn Mi vietnamese sandwiches.  I think the long line at 12:30 on the dot explains why this place is such a hit in the Financial District.  

My only gripe is the one time I got the Duck meat for the sandwhich and there really wasn't much meat going on compared to my friend's pork which weighted in much heavier than mine.

The Pork is my go to, spicy japapeno with the membrane left in (dangerous), delicious cilantro and carrots and then a nice peppery mayo and generous amount of savory pork.  Solid.  My friend also got the Pork Meatball and that looked sensational as well for proportions.  

I suggest getting there early and there's not too many places to sit, but we always seem to accomplish it.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Holy crap I forgot how good these sandwiches were. It blows my mind thinking how the ingredients create harmony of flavor. The place is small and on a corner which to me adds appeal for a meal running solo. Try the pork sandwich and add the sauce to it and thank me by sending me a dollar. 
P.S. I'll probably mow your lawn for one of these sandwiches.
author: Allen Y.

description: It's crowded during lunch but moves quickly. I like that all the food tastes light and relatively healthy. I usually get the chicken bowl or tofu fresh rolls and both are great for lunch!
author: Vinitha R.

description:
This place is okay to me. I don't particularly think the food is great but it's quick and convenient for lunch in SoMa. If I don't think of this place as Vietnamese food, it's decent. But compared to actual Vietnamese food, it's pretty bad. I don't really care for Vietnamese food either way so meh.

I've had the chicken bowl and the duck "banh my" and the sandwich is definitely better than the bowl. Both are really pricey for what you get. The sandwich is like half the size of a normal banh mi for almost twice the price. The bowl, I'm not exactly sure what it's supposed to be an imitation of. I thought it was a little bland. I wouldn't get the bowl again.
author: Anny T.

description: Five spices chicken sandwich was delicious! Though it's right by the highway, I like the atmosphere and decor
author: Michelle C.

description: Simple menu but delicious! Got the roast pork banh mi and it was so flavorful!! Cost $7!
author: J. A.

description: I normally steer clear of hipstery asian restaurants, but this place is GOOD! I got the chicken bahn mi and it was totally totally delicious. My friend got some kind of noodles in a bowl and he was less pleased. The restaurant is clean, you get your food fast, and there's some comfy places to sit and have a chat too. What else do you want?
author: Cat M.

description:
I have eating here many times.  I like the food just like everyone else here however it's seem a little over priced.  Three dollar a cup of broth?  It's not even organic or anything special.  Their the only bahn mi spot around the office, I had no choice.  They are good and I can't deny it.
I couldn't count how many times I been here but everytime I go come here there's always a line.  Comeon guys, get with the 21st century, you're surrounded by tech company and each one that walk in there eating works for one.  Just ask one customer, I'm sure they can and is willing to build you an app to have people order from their phones.
But I would like to see the sauce put on the side for the sandwiches.  Sometimes it could be overwhelming on the sweet sauce.
author: Aaron H.

description: This place is a lil pricey but I do appreciate how fast they can turn orders around! Really good lunch spot if you want something quick. I ordered the roast pork bowl and soup- quite tasty but smaller portions than I expected. Wish it had more vermicelli noodles with it, but flavors were there! My co worker ordered the duck bahn mi- to our surprise the sandwich was small and they didn't cut it in half. This place is easy, healthy, and quick!
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: Lunchtime spot. I like their sandwiches but their dry noodle bowls are the best. Really quite good.
author: Will D.

description:
I relly like the avacado chicken fresh rolls here. The sandwiches are also great but bit messy, lots of sauce in them which is a good thing. Also tried the house lemonade for the first time today and it was not too sweet just right. You can get complementary sriracha sauce and water while waiting for your order to be ready.

The place is small and crowded at lunch time but the line is pretty quick.
author: Suna L.

description:
Wow Cheap good food in SF.   $6 dollars for the Chicken Salad.  You can't go wrong with that.  I'll try the other types of meats.  I had the chicken and you had the fish sauce and Siracha salad.  So good. 

It's close by my office too. 

Totally recommend tis place.
author: Homer S.

description:
I went here 3 times in a row this past week. I think I'm addicted. Its great food and for a very affordable price! The french bread is crunchy on the outisde and soft on the inside, just the way I like it. I ordered the grilled pork and the flavors packs a punch! I think this will have to be my favorite so far. I have yet to try their bowls, but I will in the near future.

Overall, it's a great place to grab a quick lunch and without making your wallet cry!
author: Amanda T.

description:
Really not feeling this place. I will be straightforward and say my biggest peeve about this place is the cost. Yes everything on the menu is $6, but from a value and substitutions perspective, it is quite outrageous.

Banh Mi typically runs for $2-4 each. Quality obviously varies but I find actually correlates little with price. While Dragoneats serves up delicious food, and a bigger/healthier banh mi than usual, the justification for double the price (and recently raised in 1/2016) is just not there for me.

The bowl is even less substantial than the sandwich.

Don't come hungry, unless you plan on expense-ing your meal. In that case call me up too.
author: Ben H.

description: Great fresh spring rolls and delicious clear broth soup but why put mayo on the rolls?!?!
author: Erin W.

description:
Cool spot with interesting sandwiches. They are rather expensive given the size of them, but they are super filling due to them using good wholesome ingredients. Couple of colleagues really liked this spot, so I picked up a couple yummies for the office. I would like to come back and try more.

The staff was very friendly and suggested things to try, the service was quick!
author: Jonah K.

description:
Go here for lunch.

Get the Five Spice Chicken Banh My.

Order a Vietnamese Iced Coffee.

You will become a happy person.

Happy people are good.
author: Ananya M.

description:
Great quick food for lunch, but be prepared to wait in line! The bowls are really flavorful, though a little on the smallish side. 5-spice chicken is my favorite. 

The place is small and cramped - flooded with local workers during lunch hour, so be prepared to get shoulder-to-shoulder with others while waiting to pickup your order.
author: Steve S.

description: I'm torn. The five spice chicken bowl is tasty, but the portion is tiny. On one hand, it's great for a healthy diet. On the other, I'm still hungry!
author: Kristen S.

description: Just when I think I've got the lay of the SoMa land I discover this place. The huge lines should have led me to try it earlier, but it's weird location just doesn't lend itself to a casual walk by and discovery. Set across from the Mexican Consulate is one of the most legit Vietnamese lunch spots ever. While nothing state-side ever tastes exactly like what you would find in Vietnam do mainly to ingredient portion size, source and protein diet differences - this place not only comes close but is just incredibly tasty. I think their Banh Mi would beat out most in the city. What's even more impressive is what a machine their operation is all while maintaining great sandwich construction. Having only tried their 5 spice chicken and pork - I look forward to sampling their meatball option.
author: Darin E.

description: I need to update my review as I recently switched from ordering the bahn mi to the spring rolls. In the last few months DragonEats has really improved their spring rolls - they are so tasty and crazy cheap. I've completed stopped going to FreshRoll in the Metreon since DE provides the same amount of food, better quality, and a full $4 cheaper!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Their Banh Mi here is amazinggg!! I'm getting a craving for it already just by reminiscing about it haha. But seriously, the bread has a nice crispy exterior when you bite into it that totally complements the savory protein in the inside (I tried the tofu and the pork and they were both delicious!) and the refreshing fresh veggies cuts away at the density of protein, that when finished, you feel full but not in the bloated and heavy way.

Their banh mi range around $6-7, which is probably the best deal on their menu. I've seen some people getting the the rice bowls and honestly, they don't look as filling to me. But anyways, a great and pretty healthy lunch spot. Just get here before the lunch crowd!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Exceedingly delicious and amazing price point. Plus they're fast and the place is super cute.
author: Amy S.

description: Great duck banh mi sandwich with a good sweetness which left me wishing I had put some siracha on because I don't care for raw jalapeños.  Glad it's close to my new office but their popularity causes quite the traffic jam inside the establishment.  Ready to try the other flavors soon!
author: Eric N.

description:
Pork Banh Mi is littttt.

Fresh, crunchy on the outside but soft in the inside bread. Amazing.

Great hodgepodge of flavors.

Tried the roasted pork "banh my". The pickled veggies + roasted pork on good bread make a great sandwich.

If it was slightly cheaper it'd be five stars. Vietnamese food is generally cheap.

Will come back.
author: Jeff H.

description: I love this place...one of the most reasonably priced lunches in SOMA and the food is great! The fresh bowls are tasty and light if you aren't starving. The five spice chicken bahn mi is really flavorful and they use really fresh bread. Line can be long at lunch time but moves fast.
author: Elena S.

description: I think the main draw here is that everything on the menu is $6 or under- quite the find for SOMA. I tried one of their bowls with chicken. It comes with lots of veggies and some rice noodles and it's a good portion for lunch. I wasn't too big of a fan of my chicken- hard dark pieces of meat which was no fun to eat. The vietnamese coffee is pretty good and verryy sweet so prepare yourself for a real pick me up after you have one of those. Don't forget to grab some peanut sauce to top off your meal with (its next to the water). The line gets long at lunch but moves fairly quickly. There's a bit of indoor seating inside but nothing big enough that could handle a group larger than 4 people. I'll be back for a quick lunch but will probably stay away from the meat options.
author: Renu A.

description:
Simple, delicious, and fresh Vietnamese food.

I got the 5 spice chicken salad with papaya and was extremely satisfied. Can't wait to try the Bánh mì next time.

The portions aren't small, they are normal sized. Especially at the $6 price, you can order 2 and still have more food than a $12 entree from around the area.
author: Petar B.

description:
Came here for the opening since its near my office and right outside the window by where I sit.  I've never tried their other locations or catering in the past.

Their menu is pretty simple but very appealing.  The sandwhiches and bowls were all $6 which for being in SOMA is decently priced for what you get.  I got the Roasted Pork Banh My (vietnamese sandwhich) and it looked and tasted very good.

My coworker got the shrimp fresh rolls and it looked and tasted very fresh as well.  He is allergic to peanuts so its nice that they had peanut free alternative to the peanut based sauce vietnamese spring rolls typically come from.

If I was looking for some vietnamese food and was confined to this part of soma, for work you pretty much have two choices: Lee's Deli and DragonEats.  I would definitely pick DragonEats over Lee's.
author: Daryl D.

description: Loved this place!! It's super affordable and the food is so tasty. I was so happy to find this hidden gem in the city. The portions are also pretty big. I have no complaints!
author: Liza C.

description:
New favorite Bahn Mi Sandwich... And I have searched 35 countries looking for great ones! 

Pork meatball bahn mi - 5
5 spice chicken bahn mi - 4
author: Andrew S.

description: Not gonna lie, I'm a little obsessed with this place dubbed as Vietnamese Street Food as I came here for lunch back to back days to get takeout. For $6 you can get a banh mi, bowl, or salad with your choice of protein. I opted for the fresh bowl the first day and papaya salad the next day, both days with 5 spice chicken. The bowls have shallots (my fav!), peanuts, rice noodles, veggies and the papaya salad similar but with papaya instead of rice noodles! Refreshing with crunchy textures, light, full of flavor and not coma inducing - What else can you ask for during your lunch break?? The lines do get long. They offered up slices of bread that they use for their bahn mi which tasted freshly made as well! Will be coming back to try other items on the menu.
author: Michelle T.

description: Great Vietnamese sandwiches at an amazing price point! I thought the garlic butter chicken was fantastic. It's pretty fast to make and pretty filling by itself. The ingredients taste pretty fresh too.
author: Victor W.

description:
Don't show up hungry, otherwise you'll end up ordering everything on the menu.

I showed up hungry and ended up ordering:

- 5-spice Chicken Banh Mi
- Shrimp Fresh Roll
- Shrimp Papaya Green Salad

Was tempted to order the Vietnamese Iced coffee, but thankfully the cashier already swiped my credit card.

Food tasted great! That's all I gotta say about that.

You can certainly find a better value in the South Bay, but this place is definitely worth the trip if you're in the city.
author: Tim H.

description: The line is really long during lunch hours, but their service is really quick. I had the 5 spice chicken banh mi, and the ratio of meat, vegg, and bread was on the spot. I really liked how fresh their bread was. I'd come back to try other menu
author: Kristi K.

description:
I came here at 12:15 on a Thursday for lunch, and there was no line at all. I've heard the line can go out the door, so maybe I just got lucky. It's a small store with several seats, but most of the people inside were standing and waiting for their food. There's no designated wait area in this small room, so it seemed disorganized. However, pricing here is pretty decent, which is a huge plus.

The whole process of me ordering and then getting my order was only a few minutes, which is great. I had ordered the Garlic Butter chicken "banh my", and overall is was decent. The entire thing cost $7.34 including tax, which is not terrible, but the sandwich definitely could be bigger for the price. There was plenty of ingredients jammed packed into the sandwich, which was a highlight. The bread, pickled vegetables, cilantro, and jalapeño were all delicious, but the chicken wasn't that great. It had the consistency of canned tuna, which I found off putting. The marinade was ok, but I probably wouldn't order again.

I would like to try other things off of the menu, so I will definitely come back, and hopefully I can beat the line again. 

Update: I had the Pork bowl, and that was great! Very refreshing, with a good amount of meat, and you can pieces of bread to add to your bowl, which is a great addition.
author: Albert H.

description:
Fast. (SF)Cheap. Delicious. These are the three words necessary to explain DragonEats.

It's a very popular spot for the SoMa crowd near the area, mainly because of the three things I have mentioned above. You may see the line out the door, but they are so incredibly efficient here that even when I was out the door it still only took a total of 15 minutes to wait in line, order food, wait for food, get food, and leave. When you're inside, it's probably close to 5-10 minutes. I don't know what kind of magic they use, but this place is a well-oiled machine.

Sandwiches are decently-sized. They're not huge, but they're not tiny - it's basically a "healthy" portion of sandwich, I guess. Not that I'm the person to ask for healthy, because tasty is better than healthy to me any day. Bread is crunchy on the outside, sandwiches are filled up on the inside. They scoop out the bread in the middle to stuff it with more non-bread stuff. I've had the pork and the garlic butter chicken, and I think the pork is my favorite, but I'd definitely eat either one.

Yes, you can definitely get cheaper banh mi at a Vietnamese restaurant somewhere in the middle of the city or in Little Saigon in San Jose, but this is my favorite lunch option on Fridays because no other place has banh mi of this deliciousness. I've never had a bad sandwich here, and somehow, I feel like it's healthier. It could also be wishful thinking, though. Plus, the carrots here are really good. Like, really weirdly good. Maybe I just like pickled carrots.

Anyway, worth the short wait if you're in SoMa and you need some lunch.
author: Robbin A.

description: Solid, cheap banh mi. Crowded, but under $10 for a solid sandwich. Meat is lacking.
author: Michael A.

description:
Great, healthy, cheap lunch option in the SOMA area. (How many places can you say that about in a neighborhood filled with junk food and overpriced salad places?)

Pretty much everything on the menu is $6 -- and the portions are just large enough for lunch, apart from the salad bowls, which I find pretty small.

Teriyaki tofu fresh rolls are a great go-to -- and if you're feeling naughty the pork meatball bahn-mi is delicious. If your feeling extra hungry and need to round out your meal. the limeade as well as the kale chicken broth soup is very tasty.
author: Haley J.

description:
Ordered a garlic butter chicken banh mi and chicken soup with ginger, kale and lime. Loved the sandwich, which had super fresh veggies and soft bread with a perfectly crunchy crust.

They only serve lunch and the lines get very long right after noon but they move through the orders quickly, and it's worth the wait! The five spice chicken see me to be the most popular--excited to try that one or the duck next time!
author: Jia H.

description:
yum!

I've only had the grilled pork bun mi here but it is primo. probably one of my top 2 places for bun mi. it's a trendier spin on Vietnamese sandwiches.  a bit more rich and juicy then the usual treatment.  at $6 per sandwich it is dirt cheap compared to other financial district lunch options (tho you can certainly find bun mi cheaper elsewhere).

they get fairly mobbed at lunch, esp for a place that's further away from market st.  but service is decently fast.
author: Jimming C.

description: Had the noodle bowl and wasn't too impressed. Not very flavorful. My bf loves the banh mi though so next time I'll give that a shot!
author: Cynthia H.

description: This is the perfect spot for a quick, delicious lunch on the go. I had tofu spring rolls and kale soup for less than $10 and both were great. There isn't much room to sit so you might want to take it back to your office if you're coming during rush hour.
author: Eman A.

description:
I've only had the banh-my here, but it by far the best banh-my I've ever had.

In particular I'd recommend the duck banh-my and the five spice chicken banh-my, they are both fantastic. For some reason they don't put the duck BM on the board, but it's on the printed menu.

The line can be a bit long, but it moves quickly. And if you avoid the rush at noon it'll be very fast.
author: Jonas S.

description:
I tried out the tofu bowl and was very pleased.  They also offer rice paper rolls and bahn mi.  My coworker said great things about the Vietnamese ice coffee, so I'll have to come back and give that a shot.

No substitutions to any of the items.  There was a long line, but it went quickly (probably due to their limited menu).  The interior of the store is small, with a bar that seats 8-10 and a few tables.  Everything was very affordable, with tax my bowl came out to $7.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Dropped in for a one off experience to check it out. Experienced scrumptious food and incredibly kind service. That one off visit will definitely be upgraded to repeat patronage!

Vietnamese is always healthy and reasonably priced. DragonEats didn't disappoint. I tried the Roast Duck Banh Mi topped off with a chicken, kale, ginger, cilantro soup to soothe my impending cold.

The handsome server noticed me bundled up in my winter sweater, sniffling into a pile of tissues and came over to gift me a lemony drink free of charge. Such a nice gesture - made my day, & DragonEats probably cured my cold. Highly recommended!!
author: Bryan C.

description: New fave lunch place in SOMA! Excellent prices, delicious bahn mi. Really can't complain about some tasty, cheap Vietnamese food. Space is limited, so plan on taking your food to go in case you can't snag a spot indoors!
author: Anna X.

description:
I'm Vietnamese and this is by far the best Banh Mi in town. I gave it 4/5 because my standard for vnmese food is perhaps higher than americans, It would be 5/5 if I'm american

It cheaps, friendly/fast service and taste awesome. Of course it still tastes a little bit different than an original Banh Mi in VN because of the difference in vegs & bread. 

Spring Rolls 10/10, one of the best SR I've eaten

As for the 5 spice chicken fresh bowl, I'd say it tastes just okay. Probably because they can't make or get an original VNmese fish sauce from VN. Fresh bowl need the right fish sauce for it to taste good.
But like I said, my taste of vnmese food is different.
author: Phuong P.

description: I've just discovered this little place thanks to my new colleagues. I had the Pork Banh Mi and it's delicious. It's very authentic just like the way my grandma would make it. And where can one find something this good under 10 bucks in SF?!
author: Elwood H.

description:
I had a roasted pork sandwich and it wasn't bad.
In my onpinion, it has too much coriander which has strong flavor. If you like this flavor, you can try it.
author: Young K.

description: Bahn Mi and fresh rolls are very popular here. The line can get very long, and the quality of the food will decrease with the length of the line. I have waited 20 minutes for a chicken sandwich here. There are better options, with similar food within 2 minutes of this place.
author: Stanley R.

description: Solid price for solid food.  Loving this family operated joint that sells banh mi, spring rolls, and bowls.  I only got the spring rolls which were alright but the Vietnamese coffee here was on point.  Come here at 11:30 to avoid the huge lines
author: Vince L.

description: Delicious, fast, healthy, and filling, this place is a weekly staple. I get the pork bowl and a side soup, and (gasp) pour the soup into the pork bowl for a pho-like meal. Splash some sriracha on top and you've got a winner for a $10 and some change. Skip the soup, and you've got a delicious & nutritious lunch for under $7. Now THAT's a deal.
author: Alex L.

description: Great sandwiches and fresh rolls. Quick, no nonsense. Can be a bit crowded at times.
author: E C.

description:
Excellent pork meatball banh mi.  Well seasoned, tasty, juicy.  Plenty of veggies.  I love it with extra jalapeños and some Sriracha sauce on the side.  The sandwiches are always fresh, you can watch them make them.  Simple, fast service.  The line moves quickly.  A must try for a quick, delicious lunch.  They have very limited indoor bar style seating so try to get there by 11:30 a.m.

The gentlemen taking the orders is super friendly and nice!  Keep up the great service!
author: Ana W.

description:
theres not too many banh mi places in soma that are worthwhile but this place is actually very good.
there is always a line during lunchtime since its a super easy place for a grab and go lunch.

dont expect the portions to be very filling though as the bowls have just enough food to eat and not be hungry anymore.

the banh mis are made quite well though as the bread is heated nicely to be crunchy.

the meat is very tasty and the chicken and duck are definitely the highlights.

the price is decent for soma but its expensive for a banh mi in general so if you weigh those two criterias together, then it makes for a good lunch if you work in the area.

the lines can seem long, but it moves very fast and the wait for your order is not very long.
author: Alex H.

description: Garlic butter chicken banh my is so delicious! And they are fast, despite the line at lunch. Always fresh, flavorful and delicious. Go and enjoy!
author: Mark A.

description:
Word started going around my office about this place about 2-3 months ago, and I was feeling meh about checking it out. Then one day I just hit a wall and decided I need to get something other than a regular sandwich or salad.

Walk in for the first time and I'm like $6 for everything? STFU. Was my first reaction. But, then I got all skeptical thinking, this can't be filling then if I just order one thing. Being a true fatty, I ordered a chicken avacado fresh roll, and then a roasted pork fresh bowl on my first visit. I didn't want to go hungry, plus I just like trying a bunch of different things whenever I go to a place for the first time.

The bowl was legit. Was a good serving of everything and the roasted pork was legit. The rolls I will probably pass on next time. Nothing to amazing about the chicken and avocado, or the peanut dipping sauce. There is a small selection of options on the menu. Basically, it's just variations of the banh mi, bowls and rolls. I'll probably either keep getting the same pork bowl, or check out some of the banh mis next time.

The place is tiny, and felt like it could get pretty warm inside real quick. Not too much space to sit down, so don't expect to come here with a group of people and chill.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Came here a few times with my boyfriend, since I wanted to have some bahn mi. The store itself is quite sizable for a small space, with a nice partially open kitchen and spacious layout. This place gets VERY crowded during the lunch rush hour (~12 PM/1PM), so don't be shocked if you find a long line that goes out of the door.
My boyfriend always gets the duck bahn mi. Although he's not a huge fan of pickled veggies, he never leaves a trace of them. It's not excessively pickled but still has the same bite of vinegar, which is a great complement for the sweet, savory duck. My go-to is the roasted pork. It is a bit fatty, but the taste is amazing. The only real con to the pork is that it's quite oily and seeps through its wrapping and the to-go paper bag; however, I think its worth it, since this place has a great little spin on traditional bahn mi.
I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area looking for a light lunch without feeling overly stuffed!
author: Marissa O.

description:
Arriving at 12:20PM on a Weds it was very busy but they know their stuff and our food came very fast, considering the crowd. Worth the walk!

I thought it was great, definitely better than the other Bahn Mi I have found in the FIDI. I had the Five Spice Chicken and my husband had the Roasted Pork. Both tasty! The pork was a bit greasier and heavier - but some days I would want that.

Good amounts of jalapeno on the sandwich and nicely pickled carrot and diakon. Yum. Looking forward to trying some of their other $6 options for lunch.
author: M B.

description:
Around the area I work in, there aren't many Asian food options...what a shame :(. I found DragonEats and I got the chicken vermicelli salad for lunch. 

Taste: I don't think it's anything special, but it was nice to know that there is a Vietnamese option nearby.

Portions: The portions are average. It's definitely not the size of the vermicelli salads you get at a typical pho place, but you'll for sure get full from it (a.k.a. no food coma).

Price: I think the salad was around $6 or $7? I'd say the price is pretty reasonable for the area it is in. 

Would I eat here again? - If I absolutely have the biggest craving for Asian food, then yes, I would come back.
author: Denise K.

description:
Really enjoyed both their pork and sardines banh mi. At $6 ($6.53 with tax or $7.51 with a 15% tip), this is one of your cheaper options for lunch in SOMA. They're consistent with their quality, service and ingredients. They also do a great job with basically everything on their menu. From their banh mi, vermicelli to their spring rolls, grilled pork is definitely your best option. For spring rolls, the chicken avocado is also very good. They also serve a savory ginger kale soup everyday that's great with anything you order. The Vietnamese coffee is not bad either! 

Expect lines outside the door from 12PM to 130PM. I like to go earlier like 11:30AM or as late as 2PM. It's not so bad at that point. Even then the lines move quickly.
author: Camille L.

description: Really awesome bahn mi. They fill up the sandwiches full of good stuff. Slightly more expensive than normal viet subs but definitely worth it
author: Pierce J.

description: My favorite bahn mi! Haven't found one in the east bay nearly as tasty. My mouth waters just thinking about the pork sandwich.
author: JoAnn C.

description: This place is super crowded during lunch time. But the duck sandwich deserves the waiting!
author: Wei X.

description: Yay for cheap and delicious lunches! This place serves good quality banh mis. They might not be as long as traditional banh mis, but they are definitely worth a try. I love coming here because of the cucumber water. If there's anything that keeps me coming back to a restaurant it's the taste of their water. Pandan leaf water and cucumber water are among my faves.
author: Kay C.

description: The soup is amazing! Ginger Chicken Broth and Kale. The Duck Bahn Mi is equally as amazing! Also very fast service!
author: Kenny O.

description:
Ordered the duck Banh Mi and was very satisfied. More "upscale" ingredients than the places I am used to in the South Bay.  And prices are really good too,  ($8 for duck, $7.50 for others), which is on par with other places around here that serve worse sandwich fare.  Will definitely be back to try the other banh mi and the rolls, which my co-workers and fellow Yelpers also rave about. The best thing is the price. 

If you want to avoid a line, get here before 12 noon. But even if you come at the peak, service is fast, and you should be on your way fairly quickly.
author: Nolan K.

description: Great spot! I had the roasted pork sandwich - amazing! The line looked a little intimidating since it spilled over into the street but it went by quickly. Ingredients are very fresh.
author: Lauren W.

description: Normally it's good (though sandwiches can be greasy), but today I ordered rolls for the first time--chicken and avocado--and they gave me shrimp, which I can't eat. Didn't notice until I got back to my office 15 minutes away.
author: Phuong M.

description: I had the 5 spice chicken Banh mi and it was delicious! I loved how they have complimentary cucumber water and plenty of seating.
author: Katherine R.

description: Really delicious Vietnamese sandwiches with fresh ingredients and decent meat portions.
author: Pat Y.

description: Good lunch place with decent prices, particularly given its proximity to SOMA/Financial District. The lunch line can get a bit hectic right around noon, and the place is a bit too small to accommodate the large crowd, so would recommend getting there early to avoid the rush. Also love that they offer catering!
author: Sarina C.

description: I got the salad with shrimp and papaya. It was superb and fast service! Fresh and clean without being ridiculously filling.
author: Katherine C.

description:
On a wet drizzly day around 11:30 am,   I enjoyed the cilantro chicken stock soup and five spice chicken sandwich.   I had to remove the jalapeño because it was too hot for me.   Sandwich was the perfect compliment to the soup.  Filled me up and got me refueled.  Now ready to tackle my afternoon work. 

Sandwich $6.50
Chicken broth soup $3.25
author: E. C.

description:
$6 sandwiches - can't beat that in San Francisco, sort of a random location, but whatever, most of the random places i've found end up being the best places every. 

Had this place after a night of food poisoning so was taking a risk with the 5-spice chicken, but no regrets were had. 



definitely will come back to try some of the other items.
author: Laurens D.

description: Great food, great prices.  I had the pork bowl and chicken avocado spring rolls, both packed with meat and veggies and both ready within about 15 seconds of ordering! (They were already packed in to go boxes, but freshly made).  I arrived right at opening, around 11am, so I beat the lunch crowd.  Meat quality was quite good, especially for the price.
author: Jean H.

description:
DragonEats is an efficient, relatively popular takeout lunch spot in SOMA. They serve very fresh Vietnamese bowls, banh mi, salads, and rolls (all $6). You can choose chicken, pork, or tofu as the protein in all of these. They operate in an open kitchen with a very quick production line; I literally waited less than a minute for my food, which is a good or bad thing.

I opted for the 5-spice chicken bowl, which came with an assortment of veggies, peanuts, vermicelli noodles, and fish sauce. It was very refreshing, and a moderate value for the price. There really is nothing bad to say about DragonEats, but it is also unmemorable and the food is easy to piece together on your own. At $6, it's not a bad price for a light work lunch.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Loving this place.  Great as a lunch option. 

In the Embarcadero/SOMA part of town there really isn't much for lunch options.  So the whole office was very excited at the prospects of DragonEats opening up just 2 blocks away from us. 

They offer some great Vietnamese staples; Bahn-Mi, Fresh Rolls, Vermicelli salads, all $6.50 each (plus taxes).   Compare to other lunch options such as Spice Kit, it taste and feels fresher and its cheaper too. 

Though there's not much waiting space and there's always some confusion about whether people are in line to order or in line waiting for their food.  Maybe instead of a number system they can do the buzzer thing, then we don't have to wait around the same area waiting for our food. 

Also there's not much sitting room.  So take out is best. 

Either way, this is a solid lunch place.
author: Maggie F.

description:
So so seconds.

This dragon movie was just OK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=84CLnZZzsa8

This DragonEats bowl was also just OK: Good but underwhelming portion of primarily dark meat chicken, noodles and greens. Soy sauce gave it an extra flavor boost.

Similar rating at the original Hayes Valley location: http://www.yelp.com/biz/dragoneats-san-francisco?hrid=k7Pm_SAU5rAaE7tDQxAqYQ

Price wasn't so much the issue here ($6) but the quantity was. Friendly staff and nicely designed space (emphasis is counters over tables) keep the third star.

Will likely pass on a third movie and third location.
author: Jason B.

description:
These guys have nailed it. Granted I'm a sucker for good, fresh Vietnamese food, but that also means I have a lot to compare it to. I have yet to try something I didn't love, but my daily go-to is the chicken fresh rolls. Perfectly substantial "light" lunch for 6 bucks. You can't beat it. And I see some reviews mentioning small-ish portions -- if you need more food, order two dishes and it's still only $12... easy fix.

It's also worth noting that the customer service is beyond outstanding. They always greet you with a smile, seem genuinely thrilled that you're there, and go above and beyond if something isn't absolutely perfect. I've actually never experienced such a clearly "customer service" focused spot in SF. Keep it up!
author: Matthew H.

description: The food is still amazing this time. However, they are giving out less and less duck in sandwich. ;(
author: Yating L.

description:
Exactly what I need. Now I am sitting here on lunch for the first time, thinking why they won't open after 4pm so that I can come by again :)! 

The price is not cheap. I don't particularly dig hipster style so I know I am paying a bit more for that which I do not need. However it is clean, and pleasant so I'd say it is totally worth it. 

Also, I am impressed for the efficiency. At 12:30pm, I was last one in a line like 20 people, by now I am done eating. Their order system is smart, well thought, I don't know what my number's prefix 'A' is for, but I know next time I order something different, I will get different prefix. Smart. 

1pm. Relax, read a little then go back to work! 
One request : can I prepay you so I can just come by for my lunch twice a week? Well done guys!
author: Fort Z.

description:
I think the only real edge they have is that the only other place to eat in a 2-block radius here is Local kitchen (pizza + wine, $$$). This place would be better if:

1) Portions weren't so small

The food is alright, not bad for the area, and I expect the price to be higher, but the portion I got for Five Spices Chicken bowl was just too, too small. And they charge way too much for a banh mi, premium or not.

2) They were actually open

Their Yelp! posted hours are M-F 11A-6P, but I have yet to go there between 5-6 and see them open. Their "open" sign even says they close at 4PM. I'm glad they amended their weekend hours too, as a few Saturdays ago at noon I checked yelp and it said they were open until 6PM, so I walked over only to find them closed; someone was inside but the doors were locked. At least for the first few months, it's seemed really at-random whether they were open or not.
author: Ryan D.

description: I love having new lunch spots in the neighborhood.  DragonEats is a super cheap place $6 for a banh-my and it was really good.  I got the five spiced chicken and it had a really good kick. Check it out and help a local small business.
author: Blake B.

description: Expensive and really small portions. Had a bowl and fresh roll. And i was still starving. Spent nearly $30 as well. Really expensive for such a small portion
author: Eugene L.

description: Woohoo for a place that doesn't charge way too much for a sandwich (with a 15% tip, I paid $7.51). I got the teriyaki tofu banh my (interesting that no two places seem to spell it the same way) and quite enjoyed it with and without the jalapeno peppers. The bread was fresh and crunchy, the whole thing was quite juicy, and I loved the flavors. The place itself is welcoming and well-lit. Overall a great experience.
author: Michelle G.

description:
Great price, great quality, and clean shop.

I seriously love Vietnamese food and will definitely go to DragonEats at least three times a week for lunch.
author: Chris P.

description: I had the duck banh mi and it was delicious. It gets pretty crowded for a small place but it was quick to get my order and not too long to get my food. Highly recommended.
author: Jonas K.

description: My first visit, and first meal in the Bay. Ordered the Banh My Five Spiced Chicken and an iced cold Vietnamese Coffee. Even for a busy 12 o'clock lunch rush, the meal was delicous, made fast and fresh.
author: Kumalah J.

description: Great lunch option. The pork fresh bowl was really fresh and healthy. Would definitely return.
author: L.L. M.

description: Affordable, fast, delicious. I tried the fresh rolls with tofu first-minty, fresh, tasty protein, great peanut sauce (they also have fish sauce and sriracha as an option). So yummy. The second time round, I was so tempted to order the fresh rolls again, doubting that an option could possibly be better. But in interests of variety, I tried the tofu banh mi. Warm, crusty baguette, flavorful protein, crispy, fresh veggies; it exceeded my expectations. Mmm. If you're of the late-to-the-party class that has doesn't regularly eat Vietnamese food, I recommend the banh mi as a sort of bunny slope, as it's essentially a better version of a classic sandwich. Love how this place has vegan, gluten free, and low carb options, all without overpricing their food, a problem found in 70% of SF restaurants.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Great vietnamnese sandwiches. Perfect for a quick lunch.
author: Toby V.

description: Don't really pick Vietnamese if I have a choice. So this was a nice surprise. Got the chicken bowl and was delicious. Prices here so reasonable too.
author: J A.

description: Had the bbq pork bahn mi and it was delicious. This place is as good as it gets for Bahn Mi in SoMa.
author: Yash R.

description: Such good fresh Bahnmi :) the flavours were true to each ingredient which made the simple dish wholesome and tasty!!
author: Michelle L.

description: Yummy lunches!  Love the duck banh mi sandwiches, as well as the rolls.  Get there early to avoid the long lines.  The price is reasonable and quality is quite good, especially compared to Bun-Mee on Market Street.  The Vietnamese ice coffee is refreshing, too.  One of my favorite places for a quick bite to eat.
author: Bruges L.

description: Delicious. Pricier than your mom/pop $4 sandwiches, but also packed with much more meat, filling, and flavor.
author: Howe L.

description:
Love Dragon Eats! Wish they were open longer hours or weekends.

Each item is $6, somewhat small portions but it is only $6.

I've tried the fresh bowl with 5 spice chicken and grilled pork, and the shrimp spring rolls. All are very tasty.
author: CL S.

description: Love this place.  Probably been here 20 times and always get the same thing - tofu bahn mi.  I like how they warm the tofu and the asian style sauce is da bomb.  Hard to find great, unique, tasty, filling, home cooked style lunches for less than $9 in SOMA, but this was my go to place when I worked close by.  Not a ton of seating inside, but the staff is friendly and all my co-workers love their sandwiches.  Highly recommended.
author: Rick K.

description: This is a very good but very expensive banh mi place. The pork sandwich is very good. My office moved so I never go here anymore.
author: Karl K.

description: The best Banh Mi I've had in San Francisco. Super fresh ingredients. Delicious bread. And cheap! I'm a huge fan of the garlic butter chicken and the pork meatball!
author: Isaac F.

description: Portion a bit small for the bowl, minimal noodle, but very good flavoring.  For $6 everything item on the menu, its a good quick bite.  Come early as there is a line to order and a wait to pickup.
author: Ju D.

description: Working in the SOMA/Financial District border we surprisingly don't have a ton of great options for lunch. When I heard about DragonEats I jumped at the opportunity to try something new. The restaurant itself is pretty small, I wouldn't recommend coming with a group if you want to sit down and eat there. The line was relatively long but moved really quickly, I was super impressed with how quickly they got the food out. I had the garlic butter bahn mi and we also split prawn fresh rolls -- both were very tasty! A bonus, everything is $6 on the menu! I will definitely be adding this into my lunch rotation.
author: Lizzy U.

description: One of my go to lunch spots during the work week. They are always friendly and they now remember me every time I come in, (sometimes giving me extra rice noodles.) Their spring rolls with the peanut sauce are excellent. Both the 5 spice chicken and pork bowls are great as well!
author: Miles D.

description: I ordered the five spice chicken banh mi for lunch.  The place is casual and I had my food within 5 minutes. The taste of the sandwich was amazing and had just the right amount of spice for my palate.  It was perfect sized sandwich for lunch and only costed around 8 dollars.  I had been craving a banh mi all day and this shop definitely came through.
author: Salil K.

description: This place is so delicious and affordable, it's a struggle not to go here more than once a week. I've had the five spice chicken, roasted pork, and pork meatball banh my and they were all amazing, though roasted pork is my favorite. The place gets packed during lunchtime on weekdays, but the line moves fast and so do the kitchen staff. They are also friendly and helpful.
author: Laura H.

description: Very fresh, papaya salad served with warm chicken in medium sized bowl.  I would be willing to pay more for organic, free-range products.  Sourcing is more and more important for the discerning palette. Nice space, quick service, limited but comfortable seating.  Grab n'go
author: blaine s.

description: Shrimp rolls are delish.  Limited seating and long lines at peak time, but it seems to move fast. I'm not a fan of the pork bahn mi (found the meat pieces to be super fatty and I threw away half of them). The meatball bahn mi is good, haven't tried the chicken. The bread for the sandwiches is also tasty.  Yay for another lunch option in this deserted area.
author: Emily L.

description: My coworker and I have been coming here for lunch once or twice a week for the past several months! It's healthy, cheap, and delicious. The place is always crowded and awkward (because of the cramped layout) but that's ok; we're used to it now :) The line looks long but it goes pretty fast. After you order, get yourself a cup of yummy cucumber water and some sriracha to-go. My favorite thing to order is the chicken avocado spring rolls. If it's cold, I'll get a cup of the kale soup.
author: Crystal L.

description: Asian fusion? Fused with what? It's just Vietnamese done right. Excellent but be prepared for a long line around lunch.
author: Jason S.

description: The pork bahn mi is on point, and only $6! Owner very nice as well - he came out to ask how everything was and wished me a happy Friday. Will definitely be back.
author: Andrew C.

description: Went yesterday with my coworker and we both had the pork banh mi sandwich and it was delicious. Extremely affordable and filling lunch!
author: Charlotte C.

description: Perfect place to go if you want a light $6 entrée prepared quickly. There's only about 4 things on the menu so it makes it that much better for indecisive people.
author: Michael B.

description: Pork meatball Banh My is my favorite SF lunch spot.  Amazing flavors I couldn't create at home bursting out of a perfectly crunchy roll.
author: Jason P.

description: how can you go wrong with a $6 lunch? everything I've tried has been great, but I keep going back to the tofu bowl. always busy, but the line moves quickly. there are only a few seats inside and not really many places to eat outside in this area, but great for taking back to the office.
author: Bob U.

description: Wow this place is good, had delicious shrimp rolls with the banh my pork sandwich, and a chicken bowl. Great food, the place is tiny so ideal mostly for takeout.
author: Louie V.

description:
Love dragon eats especially their Bahn Mi. The bread is fresh, crunchy on the outside and perfect on the inside. It's just the way the bread should be.

The vegis are crisp and fresh and you can tell they have not been sitting in the freezer for ever.

Now wait for it - $6 for A Sammie in SOMA? Yes, I said it. Perfect working lunch option. 

Wish they would add soup noodles to their menu.

Decor is adorable!
author: linda g.

description: Meatball sandwich .. Best I ever had!!! Fresh ingredients.. Bread is soft and crispy.. Cilantro's always fresh.. Meatballs crumble as you eat ...Just the right amount of butter and thinly sliced jalapeño allowing you to place siracha as you go... Flippin amazing .
author: Juliana R.

description: Love this place super clean and great tasty fresh food the staff is really nice too! My faves are the shrimp fresh rolls and the shrimp green papaya salad . Get here early before the lunch crowd arrives as there will be a long line but the wait is not very long the food is incredibly fresh and the people who work here very nice ! It's one of my regular places to come to easy to find just a short walk from 2nd and Folsom right on the corner !
author: lyn m.

description: $6 awesome sandwiches. Love the tofu option, and get it all the time for lunch in SoMa. Coffee is excellent and the service feels like family. Highly recommend trying at least once.
author: Kim V.

description:
got the tofu banh mi.

it was ok.

like everything else in this area (SOMA/downtown), they always over-salt & over-oil for people who have no palate/sense of taste left.

but the tofu given was generous, i won't be starving again in an hour, but you could tell it was just straight up soy marinade, nothing else added in it for complexity so it was too strong in relation to everything else

would've like to see more crunchy onions or garlic inside for more flavor depth, but instead it was a TON of onion oil that made the sandwich partially translucent on the bottom
author: Samantha W.

description: Had my very first banh-mi here and just loved it! So fresh, really bold flavors, perfect bread. The menu here is simple: about 5 proteins, which you can have as a roll, sandwich, soup, or salad. That's mostly it. But everything we had was executed exceptionally well, and the service is fast and friendly. Well worth a visit.
author: Lisa B.

description: Pork meatball bahn mi is super legit.  Fast service.  5 stars.
author: Ryan M.

description:
$6 for a sandwich??!

Ordered garlic butter chicken "bahn my"

Flavors were pretty good. Price was not that great. 

Not enough meat Bc there was toooooo much bread. 

Didn't ask if I wanted jalapeño... The jalapeño was way too spicy and the cashier usually asks if I want it or not. Definitely not the case here. 

Portions are very very small. 

Worth a try. Might not be going back.
author: Jtina K.

description: Overpriced faux-Asian food.  I've learned to accept that's the norm in San Francisco.  But, it still mildly annoys me that places like this exist...
author: N H.

description:
Fresh new taste compared to what I'm used to in Boston. I got the duck banh mi and the shrimp summer rolls. I highly suggest the duck banh mi. The meat was very tender, juicy, and the sauce and veggies complimented each other  very well. I almost got the pork banh mi but the staff said this one would have more flavor and be different than the original pork. He was right! 
The summer rolls were average; not bad but not super awesome either. 

Five stars if it were a little cheaper, considering the size. However the staff are very friendly, there's free infused water, and the food is very delicious. Definitely give DragonEats a try!
author: Amber L.

description: Very good spot!  Had the chicken bowl with salad. Deliciious and cheap too!  Only cost 6 bucks.
author: Pat D.

description:
I went here on the recommendation of a work colleague and have no regrets. I've had the five spices chicken bowl, the garlic butter sandwich and the meatball sandwich and all were delicious. I think my favorite may be the chicken bowl, I recommend this especially if you want a light lunch. The food is tasty and the sizes just right for lunch. 

The service is good and fast and the price is I believe the best in the area. Overall definitely worth trying!
author: Caroline A.

description: There are many Vietnamese places around, and the lunch they serve here is excellent and for a really really reasonable price.  I've been to Bun Mee, Urban Picnic, and Fresh roll and the taste is never fresh when I order from these restaurants.  I highly recommend coming here instead of these places.  Every time I come here I feel  like it's a nice home cooked meal.
author: Artee L.

description: Delicious and pretty inexpensive food. I've found that one item isn't quite enough for lunch, so I usually get 2 items and save some for later. I've had all their bowls which are delicious, and a few of their sandwiches. I wasn't too impressed with the shrimp spring roll last time I got it though; pretty much all lettuce with a tiny piece of shrimp in each piece.
author: Lindsey G.

description: High quality tasty flavorful food. Authentic and a great price for the portion. Highly recommend.
author: Eileen L.

description: Very good food as for an Asian taste guy. Though places look just so so. Meat and bowel are really good.
author: Hui L.

description: I enjoyed the food. It is not great, but it surely was fresh and hit the spot.
author: S. G.

description: Hidden place with a Vietnamese twist.  If you are looking for authentic Vietnamese food this wouldn't be a good place but people were lining up out the door during the lunch hour. Food was okay but they had affordable prices and friendly staff.
author: T D.

description: I just LOVE their Banh Mi! Very tasty food, and friendly staff.
author: D C.

description: This place is awesome. The staff is very friendly and the food is great. My wife is Vietnamese and she says that the food is very authentic. My only request is for them to stay open in the evening and weekends!!!!
author: Tad B.

description:
I always go here for their shrimp spring rolls, which are awesome, super fresh and hella cheap. $6 for a very filling lunch (but I get two peanut sauces).

We got our lunch catered by them today and the spread is AMAZING. So much food, looks super presentable (which doesn't always happen), and unbelievable. I finally got around to trying their pork sandwich and it might be one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Great food, you have my business for life (or for as long as I work in SOMA).
author: Jessica C.

description:
I'm obsessed with this place, I love the spring rolls.  the food is very fresh and the open kitchen is beautiful and clean.  I could drink the peanut sauce!

while another reviewer complained about the $6 price as expensive, I'm stoked because there are not many places in SF where you can get lunch under $10.
author: Amy Nicole W.

description: Best bang for your buck in the area. Loved the spring rolls and salad bowl. A little funky to walk there, but I can deal with that for the speed and price of the place.
author: Gigi B.

description: It was 2pm, my stomach was growling and I had just come from my Client's home after setting up a waterproof cushion for her shower chair. Shower chairs aren't exactly the most sanitary thing I could be touching before lunch so I really wanted to wash my hands before eating, not to mention that after a day of marathon home visits and meetings I needed to pee. I thought I could resolve all three of my issues easily by ducking in here for lunch. I order a 5-spice chicken banh mi (just ok, nothing to get excited about) and a coke. After paying and giving a 15% tip to a cafe with no table service I asked to use the bathroom. The woman behind the counter told me they do not have one and I should walk to the Starbucks on 2nd to use theirs. HOLD THE FREAKIN DOOR. Do you expect me to believe that you really have no bathroom for your paying customer? I call bullshit. And I called the Health Department.
author: Meagan M.

description: Decent food at a very reasonable price.  Had a butter garlic chicken banh-mi which was very tasty.  On the small side but the price fits.
author: wade g.

description: Just discovered Dragon Eats today after seeing a co-worker with their food yesterday, and I'm a fan now!  Tasty healthy Vietnamese food at a very reasonable price. I'm coming back!
author: K B.

description: Visited this place during it's first week of opening. I like the vibe, layout, furniture. I ordered for a chicken banh mi sandwich and soup to go. Overall the food was fresh and tasty. Will be back.
author: Malvika J.
